results.description:
2 Rules for the meet up:

1) No solicitation of services *cool if someone comes to you but consultants/lawyers/coaches beware, any sales pitches and you'll have to find a new Monday ritual

2) Make sure to state whether what you are saying is an opinion or fact (both very much welcome) so to not confuse anyone about where the point of view comes from

Location change: Repair The World - 6022 Broad St. (Around the corner from Zeke's Coffee - grab your coffee from there and head over)

Share or listen to ideas but don't be fooled this is not startup therapy or feeding the ego this is about getting to work and removing the obstacles to make your idea a reality.

All entrepreneurs are welcome and it's not uncommon for us to have musicians, artists, chefs, writers, developers, renovators, or just about anyone else you can think of join the conversation.
results.name: Get your ideas or business UNSTUCK!

venue.name: Meet outside Alpha Lab Gear / Thrill Mill / Repair the World

results.description:
Entrepreneurs helping each other. Bring your ideas, questions and experiences. Providing face-to-face help and feedback for your business in bite-sized chunks.

This meetup is right after the Unstuck Entrepreneur Meetup http://www.meetup.com/unstuckmondaymeetup/ which is right there at Repair the World from 8-9AM. Think about coming to BOTH!


After meeting outside in the lobby of Repair the World / Alpha Lab Gear / Thrill Mill, we adjourn upstairs to Alpha Lab Gear.

This meetup is run by an experienced entrepreneur who started a business, ran it for over 20 years and successfully exited to a public company. He now keeps busy mentoring for a nationally recognized accelerator, reviewing business plans/pitches for investors and consulting for businesses & non-profits. When asked “why do a meetup?” he says he is looking to “pay it forward” by helping people make less mistakes than he made.
results.name: Entrepreneur Monday Morning Roundtable - Entrepreneurs Helping Each Other

results.description:
To facilitate meaningful conversations as a single group, this MeetUp is limited to 10 participants. The charge for the MeetUp will be left as a group tip to the server. We will display an 8.5" x 11.0" sign to help you find the activity. You can see a copy of the sign in the "General Pictures" Photo Album.

INTRODUCTIONS


We will have a round of introductions during each meeting. This will give you the opportunity to present yourself, your company, and your product or service to everyone else in the room. You should bring at least 15 business cards to hand out to the group as you make your introduction. Please be courteous and respectful of everyone's interest level and time -- KEEP YOUR INTRODUCTION TO 60 SECONDS OR LESS! We don't have to vacate the room immediately after the activity; if anyone is interested in learning more about your product or service, they can have a longer conversation with you right after the activity.

GUEST SPEAKER


We will have a different guest speaker every month. You can find the guest speaker that will be joining us on any particular month by looking at "Guest Speakers" under the "Discussion" tab.

WALK IN POLICY


We want to encourage attendees to RSVP for the meetings, and discourage walk-ins without an RSVP. The RSVPs help us with the planning and coordination of the meetings. Walk-ins without an RSVP will be charged $20. This fee is in addition to and separate from the cost of the lunch. The reason for this charge is to be fair with the participants that took the time and effort to RSVP. Individuals that walk in without an RSVP may have to sit at a side table separate from the main table that is reserved for participants with an RSVP. As a reminder, we want to keep the meeting limited to a small group of participants so we can have a single meaningful conversation, instead of various fragmented and superficial conversations.

results.description: There are four levels of understanding: 1. Thinking, 2. Believing, 3. Knowing, 4. Being. In the centuries after Jesus walked the earth, Christianity diverged down two distinctly differently pathways between "believing" and "knowing." Those who "believe" that they can come to "know" God by "being" God are known as Gnostics. This group examines Gnostic concepts and looks closely at the soul-stirring teachings of Jesus in the Gospel of Thomas. Understand this text by reading in the language of spirit and indeed you will have no doubt about your purpose on earth. Jesus even says so in the first verse of Thomas!

results.description:
At this meet-up we will discuss how to plan your career to get the job you've always wanted. There are only a couple ways to make this happen:
1. First, you have to know what that job is - come to the meet-up to find out how to identify the best vocational opportunity for you.
2. You have to develop yourself to the level of professional and leadership skills that qualify you for that position (whether it's inside or outside your current organization).
3. You have to find that job in the marketplace and obtain it, or.....
4. You may have to create that job yourself by starting your own business.

That's it! Sounds simple doesn't it. So why aren't more people doing it. Why aren't more people thrilled about their work? Studies show over 80% of professionals don't like their job. Nearly half of those say they "hate it." How sad. Current studies show that the average person will change jobs ever 3 years and completely re-tool their career about every 12 years in search of the job they love. Many are even quitting the corporate world altogether to start their own business. The problem is, 50% of those business will fail the first year and about 90% of those businesses will fail within 5 years.

What about you? Do any of the following describe you:
• Your talents are not appreciated & you’re stuck in a dead-end job.
• You’re stressed & need better work/life balance.
• Your present boss just doesn’t understand you & you need to figure out how to get the next promotion.
• You need to re-tool for a different career path, but which one?
• You’re unemployed or feel you may be unemployed soon.
• You are thinking about starting your own business.
• You’re just starting out and need guidance in getting started in your career.

Ready to take control of your career? Come to the meet-up on Monday, February 8 at 6:30pm. Refreshments will be provided. Respond to this invitation so I know how many are coming and can be prepared.

In the meantime, if you need more information, contact me at:
Curtis Songer
[masked]
[masked] (I am located in Pittsburgh!)
or check out my web site at www.truthatlife.com
results.name: Get Together & Discuss How to Plan Your Career to Get the Job You Always Wanted!

Sign up as an individual - great way to meet new friends! - with a group of friends or as a full team. Only eight total team spots available each night!

Monroeville Sports Center is conveniently located off of 376, 22, 48 and the Turnpike. Facility has a rubberized surface making for fast play. Full sized goals and border boards on 3 sides of play.

Choose from: Wednesday or Monday Coed 5v5. You DO have to be flexible if you are signing up solo or with a friend.

February 3rd league is coed 7v7 at Cool Springs. Also $69!

What's included in the price?


• 7 weeks of regular season plus one week of playoffs
• 1 friendly and certified referees per game
• 5 v 5 (Coed: 2 women on field minimum)
• Two 25-minute halves
• Championship t-shirts/trophies
• Food/Drink specials at sponsor bar

Format
5v5 (Coed: 3 Males:2 Females--you may have more than 2 females on the field at once, but this is the minimum requirement), includes goalie

When are we playing?
This league plays a round robin regular season with game times rotating from 7:00-10:00 start times. A full season schedule and standings will be available on sportsmonster.net by week 2.

Playing surface and what to wear:
Surface is rubberized multi-court playing surface. Recommend flat indoor shoes. NO CLEATS! Same colored shirts and Shin Guards are mandatory in all league games.

Level of competition:


- Open level.

These leagues are happening!
Don't see a bunch of people registered here? Don't worry! Many people and teams register directly on our sportsmonster.net website instead. So go ahead and sign up to play!


Full Team Registration
*Want to Register as a Full Team? -- If you want to register a full team, you can do so but roster size MUST be at least 12. And yes, you can pay for all 12 here. If players are signing up on their own, have each player/group be sure to reference one another so we know to place you together -- see questions when you RSVP.


When will I find out which team I'm on?
Once a team is formed, a roster will be provided to all the players and we ask someone from the team to volunteer to act as captain to ensure a full team is showing up each week and a positive vibe is maintained throughout the season.

Don't have PayPal? You may register through sportsmonster.net and pay by check or money order but you will be paying full value as presented on that site.

This is one of our weekly sessions. Beginners' hour starts at 7:00 with instruction on basic footwork and formations, allowing everyone to participate in some fun social dances. From about 8:00 until 9:15, we have a Social Class - the focus is on more experienced dancers and complex dances, but beginners are encouraged to stay and watch, and participate in some of the simpler dances.


Beginners are always welcome, no partner necessary. (In fact, you will be encouraged to dance with more experienced dancers rather than with other beginners.)

The $7.00 fee per person for each class covers the cost of renting the room and paying the teacher. First-time attendees and dues-paying members pay only $5. We do not want price to be an obstacle for anyone attending class. Beginners have the option of purchasing a coupon booklet (good for 10 classes) for $30. Full-time students can always pay only $3 to attend. If these options don't work for you, please let me or one of the teachers know and other arrangements can be made.

Please don't be discouraged by the lack of RSVPs - many of our members do not belong to Meetup and so do not RSVP here. There will definitely be a crowd of dancers present!

results.description:
Tired of callback hell and fighting with the event loop? Node.js is a popular choice for building web-based real-time applications, but comes with some serious drawbacks.

Elixir, a functional language targeting the Erlang VM, promises to combine the stability and scalability of Erlang with the expressiveness of Ruby. 

In this talk, two implementations of the same chat application will be compared: one written in Node.js and the other in Elixir. You will see how Elixir enables massive concurrency and fault tolerance with (callback-free) code that is easy to reason about and test.
results.name: Callback-free Concurrency: From Node.js to Elixir

results.description:
Michael Riley from Uber Advanced Technologies Center will be talking about how Uber used and modified Phabricator to support a workflow where many teams were committing to a monolithic repository. He'll be using the example of how they implemented "Submit Queues" in Phabricator as a way to show how and why you might want to  play god with an internal source control server.

Phabricator is a suite of opensource tools that helps companies develop software by hosting their own Source Control server, with support for issue trackers, task management, and other features.
results.name: Customized Devops Infrastructure: Creating an internal 'GitHub' with Phabricator

results.description:
Join us on Tuesdays for American Mah Jong! Folks begin arriving around 5PM, and play begins table by table as soon as we have three or four players plus a set.  (We usually have 3-5 tables.)  By 6:15 or so, most players have arrived. We rotate among the tables... at the end of each game, East walks around to see if another table is close to the end of their game, so that two players can swap places.   At the other end of the evening... play must end by 9PM when Panera closes.  Tables begin wrapping up play any time after 8:15 or so.


If you have never played, or if you have not played for a very long time, we highly recommend that you take a Mah Jong 101 beginner class before playing with us - beginner classes are offered every few months.  Mah jong is a wonderful game, but it's hard to learn by just watching others play!


Please order your 2015 card from the National Mah Jongg League, here: http://www.nationalmahjonggleague.org/ Amazon.com also carries the cards. Note that you want the NMJL card, and no other! (There are some colorful alternatives out there.. but we play NMJL card and rules.)

Experienced players -- please bring your cards and please bring a set if you have one.

Please do not bring any outside food or beverages into Panera! Instead, please plan to buy *something* from Panera, even if it's just a beverage or a cookie, to support their willingness to host us.

results.description:
For those beginner ukulele players in the South Hills of Pittsburgh, you can jam with other newer players at Mt. Lebanon Library the 2nd and 4th Tuesday of each month. This is for players who have had a few lessons or know some basic chords and want to learn more while playing with others. We will experiment with basic strums, alternate chords and how to move from one chord to the next. We will play songs slowly at first and then again, only faster. 


The group will decide what songs they want to play using "The Daily Ukulele 365 Songs for Better Living," by Liz and Jim Beloff. This book is available from local music stores and on line. 


Bring your ukulele and a floor music stand along with the music book. If you want to play songs other than what is in this book please notify the group the week prior so copies can be made. 


As the group progresses, we will introduce the group to more advanced players and more challenging music selections. 


If you have any questions, please contact Patty Williams at [masked].
results.name: Beginner Ukulele Jam - 2nd Tuesday

results.description:
Do you ever think about your spirit? Do you ever think you are spirit?

Your spirit is what animates you, gives you consciousness, it gives you the capacity to think and move and dream; it puts desires in your heart, it allows you to choose or not.

You are in the frequency of your physical body but you are spirit and until spirit is in your body there really is no life.

When your spirit is in your body anything and everything is possible. You become a Divine creator with the Universe.

Your Ego is part of your physical body and your personality is what you create to protect you from the gauntlet of life but it’s not your true self.

In our next meet up we will have fun and interactive session about being able to notice the different frequencies between your personality and your spirit.  We will have some very enlightening explorations to help us easily identify and be able to  go in and out of the personality and spirit frequencies.


This is not only important for your own self but it also essential when doing any type of intuitive and healing work to be able to bypass your client's personality and speak to their spirit.


Once you are able to move into spirit and feed your spirit what it needs you can commune with all the wisdom of the Universe and your spirit guides.

Look forward to seeing you at our next meet up.

Blessings,

Joe

results.description: You may have heard about the chakras in your yoga class, on television or even from your friends. This class will cover the theory behind the chakras and also will offer practices that help us connect with them.

results.description:
Join us for a 2-hour session of indoor volleyball open gym! You'll get a ton of playing time in a well-organized event. Our host will check players in, divide players into teams, and make sure that everything runs smoothly. All you have to do is show up ready to play!

Pricing:

• $7 - RSVP online and pay in advance (online rsvp closes at 4:30 pm!)

• $9 - RSVP and pay cash at the event

• $10 - Show up and play - be sure to check online to make sure there is room!

What to Wear: We are playing indoors on a rubberized all-sport surface. Most players wear volleyball-specific shoes, but gym shoes are also allowed. Please bring your shoes and change into them at the facility. This will help keep the floor clean of dirt and water.

What to Expect: Show up early! The games will begin at the time posted for this event. Players can start checking in with the event host as early as 15 minutes before the scheduled start time. If a court is available, you may begin warming up before the event begins. We limit play to 42 players per evening, which is 3 teams of 7 players per court. If we have 3 teams on a court, winners stay once and then shuffle out so everyone gets to play. If less people are in attendance, we divide based on who is there and mix things up half way through the session.

Level of Play: This event is open to all levels of play. We do our best to create even teams so that games are well-matched. Our ideal scenario is having one court of higher skilled players and one court of more recreational players. There are no referees, so players need to play with sportsmanship and make their own calls. We aim to make everyone feel welcome at these events.

Facility Information: Monroeville Sports Center is located at 855 Macbeth Drive in Monroeville. Parking should be ample in the free lot.

Minimum number of players and playing formats. This event needs a minimum of 12 people (not including the host) signed up before the start of the event in order to run. An email notification will be sent if we cancel. Refunds or credits will be issued if we cancel the event. Sign up early to encourage more people to sign up!!

Do Your Part! Help us keep an accurate guest count! If you RSVP, we're counting on you to be there. If you change your mind about playing or your guest count changes, please update your RSVP. No-Shows will be marked on your account. If space is tight, we hold RSVP spots 10 minutes into advertised start and then open spots to walk-ups.

Requirements to play: This is an adult volleyball group. You must be 19 older. Males and females of all skill levels are welcome to play. There is no required gender ratio. Players are expected to conduct themselves with good sportsmanship.

What's included in the price? Your payment helps to cover the rental costs, the hourly pay for your event host, and ensures a well-organized event.

Questions? Post your question in the comments section of this meetup and the event host or one of our organizers will reply. You can also message the organizers directly through meetup. Or, give us a call M-F 8:00am-12:30pm:[masked]-7130.
results.how_to_find_us: Check in with monitor
results.name: Tuesdays Pick Up Volleyball @ Monroeville Sports Center

results.description:
Get Heard! Get Noticed! Get Leads! (TM)

Hosted by:  Annette Locke of Premier Designs  and co hosted by Miriah Makowski of Farmers Insurance

This is an informal networking event, open to any business woman who would like to increase her business contacts or clients in the Shaler/Gibsonia area.

Things to bring:

- 10-20 business cards or marketing material

- cash for your lunch check

- $5 meeting fee (non members only)

AGENDA

11:30 pm - attendees arrive, reviews menu, gives the server their drink order, and open networking: everyone stands up to introduce oneself to others and pass their business card

11:45 pm - server takes lunch order and the sign in sheet is passed around

12:00 pm - 60 sec. commercials begin

12:30 pm - each person gives a testimony or referral for someone attending the lunch

12:45 pm - Premier member does a 5 min. company presentation

12:50 pm - WSBA announcements from Debi/Susan

1:00 pm - lunch has ended. Open networking is welcomed.

Be prepared to do a 60 second commercial about yourself. Please RSVP if you plan to attend this lunch. If your schedule becomes free the day of the lunch, then you may attend without an RSVP. This lunch is subject to cancellation when the lunch has 3 or less RSVPs. Lunch cancellation policy.

If you are not a WSBA member and you would like to attend as a guest, please contact Debi Arnett @ [masked].

OR If you have an interest in becoming a General member ($50/year) or Premier member ($100/year) of WSBA, please contact <a>Debi Arnett</a> at[masked]-6848. 

Any non member is subject for removal from this site if they RSVP for an event and they do not attend.
results.name: WSBA  The Network Lunch - Shaler/Gibsonia

This spontaneous event is a combination of Game Night and Speed Dating. Join other fun and friendly singles for a casual and comfortable party like no other!

Here is how it works…

~ Upon arrival you will be greeted by the friendliest host you’ve ever met and given a name tag with a random number, as well as a sheet to keep track of everyone you meet

~ Time to Play: every 6 minutes you will receive a mystery message with a secret task to carry out with your 6 minute date

~ At the end of the night let us know the number(s) of the people you would like to see again. ~ If the feeling’s mutual, we will exchange your contact information. Keep in mind that you will only be able to choose up to 5 people for potential matches.

https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/BmPn0BiIW0KqUuybQSILMlfhA-uY68rhWuGMn85TIeoMwuvnrmbAvVo2VIVSYAZ6w93FdrY8Pd8wMTPutWYk6TG7QqhNOxQmDTmYZK77xB-i4O3pDYu1XBiiWYRODcZwKqQj6xeo

Common Questions:

What if I don’t have a match?

Even if you don’t have a match, we’ll give you the the contact information for those who are interested in you. You never know what might happen!

100% Match Guarantee -- We GUARANTEE that you will have a match at our event. If you don't, then your next event is on us!

Can I come alone?

Yes 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.

What are the age ranges?

This event will cater mostly to single professionals in their 20s and 30s however we have events for all kinds of demographics. Check out our Meetup Group Relationship Ready Singles - Pittsburgh for more coming events (http://www.meetup.com/relationship-ready-singles-burgh)

How is this different from other speed dating events?

The brainchild of matchmaker, Danita Walton, Play Dating is a unique dating concept centered around the premise of spontaneity, fun, and connection.

Should you meet your Mr. or Mrs. right we want you to be able to tell the story as if we were never there. So forget about meeting someone and just come out and have some fun!

Ambassadors Toastmasters Club 6308 is a local chapter of Toastmasters International. Our club has been active for more than 25 years.

We are a community club and welcome everyone: professionals, retirees, students,international visitors, business owners, and community members.

The Ambassadors Toastmasters Club is part ofWestern Pennsylvania Toastmasters/District 13.  Members of our club have been and currently serve in leadership roles in the district and for Toastmasters International.

http://6308.toastmastersclubs.org/


We meet the first and third Wednesdays of each month, 12:00 Noon to 1:00 p.m in the Corporate offices and the second and fourth Wednesdays of each month, 6:30 pm to 7:30 p.m at the Restaurant.

results.description:
The Build Guild is a simple thing. A regular gathering of web-folk with no commercial purposes. 

If you're a designer, developer, strategist, graphic artist, Dr. Horrible fan fiction site operator, project manager, information architect or even a hobbyist, come on out.

Talk web, design, industry topics, share some ideas, network and make professional connections, maybe pick up a freelance project or gig. Have a pint. Have 3 pints. Meet someone new. Play a game of darts.

We meet at the same place every month. Same time. Always the second Wednesday of the month.

results.description: We have learned our first creative problem solving process, Windtunnel, that you can now use in your daily life.  Let's learn and apply our next technique, Crabapple. Unlike Windtunnel which is based upon a modern Socratic Method, Crabapple is based upon analogies. This is a significantly different approach to solving problems than Windtunnel. The Crabapple process can provide some surprising results.
results.name: Let's meetup and learn our next creative problem solving process.

Let's get together at Vincent's of Greentree for a fun night of knitting, crochet, needlepoint (or the craft of your choice) and some great conversation - and beer!

Vincent's has great pizza, a full menu, and of course a full bar! Whether you're a regular or this is your first time joining us, all are welcome! Also, all skill levels and all types of crafts are welcome! Hope to see you there!

results.description:
BeginnerPlus, Wednesday, February 10, 2016

For the first 15 minutes, we’ll review the Key of C: the C chord and its besties, C7, G7, F, Am. For the next 45 minutes or so, immersion in the Key Of G: G chord and its best friends, C, D7, G7, E7. 

In this session, emphasis is on fingering the chords: how to get from one to another smoothly with an economy of motion.


Playlist, Page in 365 and Key:


Give Me that Old Time Religion, 90/G

Hound Dog, 111/G

Folsom Prison Blues, 83/ G

King of the Road/143/ G

When You’re Smiling 265/G

Edelweiss, 75/G

Give my regards to Broadway  89/G

Glow Worm  95/G

Walk Right in 255/G

I Walk the line  138/C

Amazing Grace 21/ C  

My Blue Heaven 169/C

Buffalo Gals, 40/ C

Hey Good Lookin  108/C

Pinky G: For new folks, we emphasize the use of the Pinky G. Read the paragraph on page 11 in the Daily Ukulele. If you still aren’t a believer, try this exercise using the pinky G and moving smoothly between chords, 4 beats each. 

G    E7   Am   D7    G    G7    C    A7    D7    G

WHOA ! ARE YOU AN Absolute Beginner, just out of the box? 

If yes, please open the following link and read before coming to the BeginnerPLUS session.  http://www.ukuleletricks.com/your-first-ukulele-lesson-and-then-some.pdf

Got wine? Got a Super Bowl goodie leftover? Bring them along to share. 

========

WHAT IS "Beginner Plus"

On Second Wednesdays, we play familiar tunes at a slower pace. You’ve already taken some lessons. Now it’s time to talk about some basic strums, alternate chord fingering, and how to move and slide between chords. Learn tricks, cheats and other valuable info geared to newer players and also to those who just like to hang out and play with a group. 

Below are basic chords, get comfortable with them. Notice how many chord changes take barely a slide of your fingers. Sometimes a finger just stays in place...

Key of C:  C  D7,   C    F,   F   G7,  G7   Am,  G7    C

Key of G:  G    D7,  G   C,  C  D7,  the barred D7 and Em,  G   Em,    D7    G

Key of F:  F    G7,    F    Bb,  F  C7,  Bb  C7, C7 Dm,  F  Dm ,  C7    F

results.description:
Come out and code in GDI Pittsburgh's first Code and Coffee of 2016! After reflecting on feedback from many of our members in the year-end survey, we'll be trying out a Wednesday night Code and Coffee!

Code and Coffee is a monthly opportunity for you to work on your own projects, continue practicing what you've been learning, and meet others who share your interests. Bring your laptop, your recent projects, and your programming problems and questions.

Have a project idea and some skills, but haven’t attended a GDI event yet? Want to focus on helping others with their projects? You're welcome too!

This is also a great event for first time attendees who just want to socialize. We're very friendly and would love to have you join us. :)

As a group, we’ll hold each other accountable for completing our projects, and provide on-going support and feedback.

This event is free, but we ask that you make a small purchase. The shop is being kind enough to open outside their normal hours for us, and we like supporting local businesses. :)

Feel free to come by for the whole thing or drop in when you have time.

Share what you're interested in working on in the comments, so you can connect with people.

Need a ride to the event or willing to drive others? Please share in the comments!

Please review Girl Develop It's Code of Conduct prior to the event.

Note: This venue location is handicap accessible. :)

There is no requirement to register and no cost. All participants must be well. Please do bring your baby with you.

Pregnant mothers, currently breastfeeding mothers, mothers who are pumping and bottlefeeding, mothers who have breastfed in the past are all welcome to participate.

Meetings are led by a lactation consultant from Heritage Valley Sewickley. There is a scale available for weighing babies. Some meetings focus on a particular topic, but generally there is no specific topic. Specific topics can be addressed if requested by group participants.

Meetings of the Breastfeeding Moms Network are normally held on the 2nd and 4th Thursday evening of the month--except November and December when it is only the 2nd Thursday evening.

Storkbites is for all new mothers with a baby under a year old. Those meetings are on Tuesday mornings and moms can attend whether they are breast or formula feeding their babies.

results.description:
This is a discussion group EN FRANCAIS for those (intermediate and higher) wishing to perfect their conversational French.

I will bring materials for learning/teaching.  This will include 1 song, but there will also be a chapter from:

• La grammaire à l'oeuvre (John Barson-Stanford) - many consider to be the best grammar/conversation book ever written (I have French friends who use it for review).  John Barson was interested in using science fiction, art and other unusual 'gaming' techniques in perfecting grammar and expression.


• Le français Départ/Arrivée (Rassias - Dartmouth) - another classic text.  Rassias was by nature a theater person, and originator of a unique language learning method - very much "in your face" and physical-response oriented.


I will also focus on practicing authentic French phrases and pronunciation.

I say this, because many Americans have reached a plateau in their language learning - and this is totally normal.  BUT in order to progress to the next level, some heavy lifting is in order. 

Homework (reading, writing, listening) will be assigned, also.
results.how_to_find_us: Nous serons à l'intérieur
results.name: Int-Adv French Conversation @ Wexford Panera Breads

results.description:
Thanks to Janet Lunde for recommending this book to me.

"The youngest, half-goblin son of the Emperor has lived his entire life in exile, distant from the Imperial Court and the deadly intrigue that suffuses it. But when his father and three sons in line for the throne are killed in an "accident," he has no choice but to take his place as the only surviving rightful heir.

Entirely unschooled in the art of court politics, he has no friends, no advisers, and the sure knowledge that whoever assassinated his father and brothers could make an attempt on his life at any moment.

Surrounded by sycophants eager to curry favor with the naïve new emperor, and overwhelmed by the burdens of his new life, he can trust nobody. Amid the swirl of plots to depose him, offers of arranged marriages, and the specter of the unknown conspirators who lurk in the shadows, he must quickly adjust to life as the Goblin Emperor. All the while, he is alone, and trying to find even a single friend . . . and hoping for the possibility of romance, yet also vigilant against the unseen enemies that threaten him, lest he lose his throne-or his life. Katherine Addison's The Goblin Emperor is an exciting fantasy novel, set against the pageantry and color of a fascinating, unique world, is a memorable debut for a great new talent."
results.name: The Goblin Emperor by Katherine Addison

results.description:
Hello everyone!

If you are reading this you probably at least have a passing interest in this new modern board gaming fad. 

If you are under the impression that we play games like Monopoly, Risk, Clue, and Candyland you are in for a rude awakening.

Modern board gaming is experiencing growth like crazy!  Not only with the number of people playing games but also with the number of new releases every year.  Can you believe there were over 700 new games released last year and that number is expected to rise even more this year. 

Even relatively new modern board games that you might have heard of like Settlers of Catan is now over twenty years old and another modern classic Ticket to Ride is over ten.  We still play and enjoy the older modern games but it is primarily because the companies keep them fresh by offering expansions to the regular content.  When was the last time you saw a content update to Monopoly or Risk?

Today's board games come in all different shapes, sizes, themes, components, and our group plays all kinds.. Here are some examples of the types of games we play...

Party games like:  Codenames, Spyfall, and Dixit.

Euro style games like:  Five Tribes, Orleans, Puerto Rico, Viticulture, and Lords of Waterdeep. 

Abstract games like:  Qwirkle, Blokus, and Hive

Card games like:  Dominion, Glory to Rome, Diamonds, and Munchkin

Those are just a few of the games that can be seen being played at our meetups every week.

Our members come in all shapes and sizes and span from young to older but all seem to have a great time when we get together!

Our organizers try to be very accommodating to new players and try to pick games appropriate to your skill level and that we think you would enjoy.  Our goal is to get you enthusiastic about the hobby.

If there is a game that you would like to try out just r.s.v.p. to one of our meetups and suggest it down in the chat.  Chances are that one of us has it in our collection and we can bring it out.

Look forward to introducing the hobby to many more players in 2016 and continued good times with our regulars.

Please r.s.v.p. early so I have an idea on how many people or coming and what games to bring along.  You can always cancel your r.s.v.p. if you have a change of plans.


See you soon!

Russ.

results.description:
If you're into music, and even if you're not, here's a great opportunity to share any music you're interested in, have a cup of coffee or tea, and engage in conversation. We'll meet at Coffee Tree Roasters in Shadyside to chat, drink coffee, and listen to music. Bring your favorite music on your phone or thumb drive to share -- you can even bring an instrument to play if you'd like. And you can just come for the coffee and company – you absolutely aren't required to bring music (I will bring my laptop to look things up on YouTube as well).

Bring any music -- if you have music of your own creation, if you're passionate about a particular musician or band, or if you just like something and feel like sharing. It could be a recent find or something that influenced your childhood and got you though your teenage years. It could be something you love or it could even be something you hate -- just tell us why. Music is as much a story as anything -- it could be a story of you, or the story of the artist who created the music, or the story could be embedded in the song itself waiting for us to listen. Feel free to bring a story to share along with the music -- or not, if you prefer.

We're totally open to any kind of music so, please, bring anything you'd like to share be it classical, ethnic, heavy metal, or whatever -- even classical ethnic heavy metal (I bet it exists). We'll be meeting at Coffee Tree Roasters from 7pm (to probably 9pm though the room's booked until 10pm).

This event is also posted on meetin.org.
results.how_to_find_us: Inside Coffee Tree at 7pm, head to the glass-walled meeting room in the back.
results.name: Coffee Loves Music

A screenie pass gets you 12 films (and 12 free popcorns or sodas!) for only $80: http://cinema.pfpca.org/screenie-subscription

Winner of 4 awards at the 68th Annual Cannes Film Festival including the Grand Prix du Jury and FIPRESCI Prize.

October 1944, Auschwitz-Birkenau. Saul Ausländer is a Hungarian member of the Sonderkommando, the group of Jewish prisoners isolated from the camp and forced to assist the Nazis in the machinery of large-scale extermination. While working in one of the crematoriums, Saul discovers the body of a boy he takes for his son. As the Sonderkommando plans a rebellion, Saul decides to carry out an impossible task: save the child's body from the flames, find a rabbi to recite the mourner's Kaddish and offer the boy a proper burial.

László Nemes | Hungary | 2015 | 107 min

Trailer:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W7YvgRU15M8

results.description:
This is an INTRODUCTORY class for people wanting to start learning how to program computers. It is intended for people who have never programmed anything before; we can't cram an entire college-level programming class into one evening, but this class should leave you in a good place to keep learning on your own or attend one of our classes on more advanced topics.

The class will cover:

* Getting set up with a programming environment
* Basic input and output
* Logic, math and decision making
* Structured programming with functions
* How to make a basic calculator program

The class is taught in Python, an easy to learn but very powerful programming language, widely used in fields as diverse as scientific programming, web development, scripting, and video games. There will be follow-on classes dealing with more advanced programming, and on interfacing with the Raspberry Pi computer to control electronics systems such as robots.

You will need:

• A laptop! Or some other computer. Windows or Mac or Linux, anything will work.


• Python! Download it from https://www.python.org/downloads/ and install it on your laptop ahead of time.


• A text editor! I recommend Sublime Text (http://www.sublimetext.com/2) or Notepad++ (http://notepad-plus-plus.org/), both of which have functional free versions.


• Your brain!
results.how_to_find_us: Garage around back on Watson St. Look for HackPGH flag
results.name: Introductory Programming in Python: Free Course

No experience necessary, no partner necessary, just bring your feet and a smile.

results.description:
We're taking a break from Dunnett reading but will gather again in March to begin our 2016 group read of House of Niccolò. See details elsewhere on the page about that.

In the meantime, some of us decided to tackle a different sort of literary epic. Please join us on Saturday Debruary 13 to discuss George Eliot's MIDDLEMARCH. We're gathering for breakfast to talk about why we loved it, hated it, didn't finish it, and everything else. Who did you identify with? Who did you wish would drop dead? If you've read it more than once, how has your appreciation changed with your own aging and accumulation of experience? After all, Virginia Woolf once characterized Middlemarch as "one of the few English novels written for grown-up people.”


So, grown-ups, come breakfast in Middlemarch..in middle-February..at Ritter's!
results.name: And now for something completely different....Middlemarch

results.description:
What a great start to the new year! 

More than 20 members attended our last Meetup, and we continue to grow.

Our next Real Estate Investor Workshop is going to filled with some really good solid information, so bring your notepad and let's get down to business. We are going to tackle some of the following questions I commonly hear from new and seasoned investors.

1.Where should I be looking for my next real estate deal? 

2.What areas currently have the lowest housing prices but the best possibility of well above average appreciation and potential economic growth? 

3 .Where can I get the most return on investment or ROI? Flips, wholesales, buy and hold, lending money,  or joint ventures?
4. What ROI should I expect or demand from my investment? How realistic are my expectations or demands?

Our offices are on the corner of Ellsworth Avenue and First Street in Carnegie PA 15106. We are on the second floor. 

Here is a link to mapquest:

http://www.mapquest.com/search/results?page=0&centerOnResults=1&slug=%2Fus%2Fpa%2Fheidelberg%2F15106%2F1500-ellsworth-ave-40.393843,-80.090558&query=1500%20Ellsworth%20Ave,%20Heidelberg,%20PA...

Gluten free, vegan, soy free, unprocessed and with no refined sugar......yes, it's possible.

A part of the monthly Saturday Superfood Brunch series, this is a one-of-a-kind slow food event that typically runs for 2-3 hours, allowing guests to eat mindfully, socialize, network, have intellectual conversations, get informed about healing superfood ingredients and enjoy themselves while the food comes out course after course. By eating mindfully and not loading up on empty calories and carbs, guests leave more than full, nourished and satisfied. This is not a buffet, and table manners will be expected.

Enjoy a-whole-new-level vegan brunch items crafted by Chef Mya Zeronis of Lean Chef en Route/extraVEGANza Pgh, using GMO-free, local, organic ingredients and NO refined sugar, gluten, processed textured mock meats, vegetable protein isolates TVPs and processed vegan cheeses. A chef who weighs 98 pounds, Mya Zeronis started cooking plant-strong Burmese farm food in her parents’ kitchen at the age of 11. Despite her decade-long career in conventional, meat-centric, butter-drowned, flour-covered and sugar-coated U.S. restaurant kitchens, she identified a need for healthful foods in Pittsburgh and made it her business in 2013. By returning to her roots, she resolved some of her health issues resulted from eating whatever was readily available in restaurant kitchens. Nearly a dozen of her recipes won top prizes in national and local contests. Some others were published in magazines and cookbooks. Her monthly vegan, gluten-free brunch is discovered by foodies from as far as Austin.

Up to two children age 7 or younger, accompanied by paying adult, eat free. For each additional child or those 8-14, the cost is $10 and it's donated to No Kid Hungry.

Please email organizer well in advance if you have any food sensitivities and allergies. If bringing children under 7 years of age, please let organizer know how many.

results.description:
Galentine's Day- celebrated the day before Valentine's Day; a day to nuture your female friendships; a day to leave your hubby or boyfriend at home and celebrate with the girls!

Based on the novel of the same name, an author writing a book about bachelorettes becomes entangled in an international affair while conducting hands-on research abroad. The author and her friends are single New Yorkers who would all much rather be in committed relationships. On a whim, Julie, the writer, decides to write a book about the experiences of single women around the world. She takes a leave of absence from her job as a publicist, jets off to France, and encounters a man named Thomas, who is in an open marriage. Even as she continues her travels to other countries, Julie longs for Thomas, who meets up with her again in Bali, jump-starting a torrid affair. While Julie is off seeing the world, her friends are back in New York, growing closer to each other as their lives develop in wild ways.


Let's meetup and see a matinee of the comedy "How to Be Single" followed by dinner at one of the local restaurants. There are many to choose from nearby. 

I will post the exact time closer to the date but it will be the time closest to 2 pm!
results.how_to_find_us: Please try to be in the lobby by 1:45 pm. Showtime is 2:10pm.
results.name: Happy Galentine's Day ~ "How to be Single" Movie Matinee and Dinner

results.description:
Part 2 of a three part learning experience to discover innate intuition within yourself, and once found how to use it to self-empower, spiritually grow and enhance your life. You can join in anytime, ok to join if not at Part 1. Following meetings are scheduled for February 13, and March 12 at the Squirrel Hill Library, Room C.

Intuition is like a spiritual muscle, if left unattended and not used becomes dormant and resides deep within your consciousness. Once you acknowledge your intuition and accept its power to move you in directions that include the spirit realm, an illumination occurs to shine light on a once hidden way of experiencing.

Listening to your inner voice is often suggested, but we must first know just what that is. The group "Finding Your Intuitive Voice" will inform you how to know your voice, and through group work will practice using your intuition so it becomes second nature to live a life intuitively.

Facilitator is Suzanne Bishop, a nationally known psychic medium who is from Pittsburgh. To learn more about intuition and the psychic world discover Intuit Now at intuitz.com.
results.name: Finding Your Intuitive Voice

results.description:
I, Rebekah Gamble, HP, am offering a year long program to introduce the community to shamanic practice from around the world at my cost of providing the course. We have already had our first class, February is the second class. This will be our last publicly available class. After this class, we will not be accepting new participants for 2016.

For 2016, we are having a one year intro to shamanic practice apprenticeship program where I am sharing both my inherited traditions and the parts of other traditions I have been authorized to share with the goal of helping participants learn to use shamanic practices to help themselves and their families. This program does not make a person a shaman, though a certificate of completion can be issued at the end of the course if the person meets the requirements outlined in the student guide.

A few people found it was easier to have an event page with all the info, so I have made one for this month. This will be the last class event page as it is the last open enrollment class.

Also, as a side note, we will be bringing more chairs from other locations and setting the room up differently so there is more room and we don't run out of chairs this time! Loving this attendance! These big groups are a challenge but I am loving how we're sharing energy and growing together.

This class will cover:
-Going over the experiential assignments from January's class and seeing how the reaction sheets and introspective experiences helped you
-Five shamanic tools, how to use them and why they work
-Music in shamanic practice (healing with individual instruments will be covered at a later time)
-Experimenting with some of my tools (I will also bring some tools that you should not touch if they wish to come, but will make clear which is which at the event)
-Preparing and getting ready to do experiments over the next month, which include finding and working with power objects, working with sound and silence, working with the Axis Mundi and like projects

You do not have to bring your textbooks with you, but you will need them for assignments for the program. Here is the link to my Amazon Author's page where you can see both the textbook and workbook in case you do not have one yet: http://www.amazon.com/Rebekah-Elizabeth-Gamble/e/B00T57HTWG/ref=sr_ntt_srch_lnk_3?qid=1453067370&sr=8-3
Please remember that as I do not make money from the textbooks (they are on the market at cost), I do not carry any for sale in my trunk. You can get them online, or order them at bookstores (including Journeys in Pittsburgh).

This class, like all the classes, is $10. This is due at the class, and if you miss a class, you do not need to pay for it. This is done to cover the expenses of the program and to keep the course as accessible and unburdening as possible.

If you do not have a student guide, you need one! You can download it at the Embody Healing group under 'files' (this is found here: https://www.facebook.com/groups/embodyhealing) or you can email me and I will send you a copy at [masked].

Love to you and see you in class!
results.name: February Intro to Shamanic Practice Class

results.description:
This is one of our weekly sessions. Class begins at 7:00 with instruction on basic footwork and formations, allowing everyone to participate in some fun social dances. From about 8:00 until 10:15, we have a Social Class - the focus is on more experienced dancers and complex dances, but beginners are encouraged to stay and watch, and participate in some of the simpler dances. At some point in the evening, we will break for a spot of tea and other refreshments.

Beginners are always welcome, no partner necessary. (In fact, you will be encouraged to dance with more experienced dancers rather than with other beginners.)

The $7.00 fee per person for each class covers the cost of renting the room and paying the teacher. However, we do not want price to be an obstacle for anyone attending class. Beginners have the option of purchasing a coupon booklet (good for 10 classes) for $30. Full-time students can always pay only $3 to attend. If these options don't work for you, please let me or one of the teachers know and other arrangements can be made.

Please don't be discouraged by the lack of RSVPs - many of our members do not belong to Meetup and so do not RSVP here. There will definitely be a crowd of dancers present!
results.how_to_find_us: Look for the red door in the lower level of the church on Sycamore St, and follow the sound of the music!

results.description:
After 10 years of Attack Theatre's wildly popular signature fundraiser The Dirty Ball, Attack Theatre unveils two new fundraising concept events for 2016 -- a very eclectic, but very upscale One Night Stand (on February 13) and The Down and Dirty Dance Party on May 20. FYI, for those that might be more interested in The Down and Dirty Dance Party (which is expected to be more affordable and draw a much larger crowd) on May 20, you can RSVP here instead http://www.meetup.com/Art-lovers/events/227491993/

Attack Theatre is an award-winning modern dance company now in its 21st season which has performed over 100 original works throughout the U.S. and various countries, in addition to a providing exceptional educational arts outreach to thousands of local students.

Consider this new performance fundraiser Attack Theatre's love letter to you, our adventurous audience. Grab your fanciest duds, most comfortable shoes, and take a one night stand with us that you'll never forget. 

Rekindle your love, ignite your passion, and indulge in Attack Theatre’s One Night Stand. Our new performance fundraiser will feature premiere dance performances, as well as a full bar and splendid dinner from Ace Hotel Pittsburgh's new restaurant Whitfield. 

This Valentine’s Day weekend, make a One Night Stand that you’ll never forget.

Tickets: $250 

Attire: First Date Chic

Attendance: About 200+ guests are expected

Get a Room: Interested in making a night of it? Call Attack Theatre to book an exclusive One Night Stand package (limited quantity available) 

Check out this great article where NEXTPittsburgh mentions Attack Theatre’s One Night Stand among 10 Pittsburgh events not to miss in February! http://www.nextpittsburgh.com/events/10-pittsburgh-events-not-to-miss-in-february/2/

Underwriting: If you would like to become an underwriter for this illustrious event, please contact Attack Theatre at (412)[masked] or [masked]. Download this PDF to learn more. 

In considering the $250 tickets, please remember that this is designed to be a one-of-a-kind fundraiser (with original contemporary dance performance) which will also be including an incredible dinner and drinks from the new restaurant Whitfield http://www.whitfieldpgh.com/  Check out Whitfield's all-day menu http://whitfieldpgh.com/img/menus/Whitfield-All_Day-Menu.pdf as well as dinner menu http://whitfieldpgh.com/img/menus/Whitfield-Dinner-Menu.pdf

Check out these articles about Whitfield at the Ace Hotel http://www.post-gazette.com/local/city/2015/09/17/Pittsburgh-native-plans-meat-centric-restaurant-for-proposed-Ace-Hotel-in-East-Liberty/stories/201509160206

And check out this great article about the Ace, a 63-room boutique hotel inside the historic and former YMCA that was built in 1909 http://triblive.com/lifestyles/morelifestyles/9593967-74/hotel-ace-east#axzz3udI0YNpO

For more information about the Ace Hotel, please visit http://www.acehotel.com/pittsburgh

 And as more information becomes available for One Night Stand on February 13, we'll update the Meetup description.

And for those that might be more interested in The Down and Dirty Dance Party (which is expected to be somewhat more affordable and draw a larger crowd) on May 20, you can RSVP here instead http://www.meetup.com/Art-lovers/events/227491993/

While all of the details haven't been announced yet for both One Night Stand  on February 13 and The Down and Dirty Dance Party  on May 20, perhaps some expectations can be gleaned from the success of the annual Dirty Ball which typically provided over 1,000 guests with the experience of a one-night-only transformation of various warehouses (and other eclectic venues throughout the Pittsburgh area) with unique spaces, art installations, a wide variety of interactive games, music, dance performances, etc. In the past, Dirty Ball tickets were in the range of $50-$60 for General Admission (500-800+ people) which also included all food, drinks, and entertainment for the evening (8 PM - midnight) along with a more upscale $125-$150 option (for perhaps 200+ people) as well as a VIP option (150-200+ people; with $250 tickets) for those that wished to attend a donor reception from 6:30-8 PM. The Dirty Ball was an event like no other in the city and featured anything goes attire! The Dirty Ball almost always made the Top 10 Lists in both the Pittsburgh Post Gazette and Tribune Review.

With the huge success of Attack Theatre's previous events, we can assume that One Night Stand will also be a very edgy, eclectic evening for a one-night only experience of dance, music, art installations, interactive games, etc. 

For more information about One Night Stand, please visit http://www.attacktheatre.com/attend/one-night-stand

For more information about Attack Theatre, including other upcoming performances as part of the[masked] season, please visit www.attacktheatre.com

Stay tuned for updates!!
results.name: One Night Stand -- by Attack Theatre

results.description:
Its that time of year ... shorter days ... schools in full swing ... and well, we all want to keep skating!

For those who haven't skated the off season with us before, these are slightly less organized, unpatrolled skated.    What that means is distance and terrain varies.   Most likely there will be a hill or two ... maybe three.    And distance is usually 15-20 miles over about two to two and half hours.    We'll still be looking out for the last skater and regrouping periodically, and including an optional coffee stop mid to end of the skating.       We'll continue, weather permitting (roads dry) straight through 'til spring!
results.name: Off season Sunday morning skate & coffee!

results.description:
Since it's Valentine's Day. I thought it appropriate to discuss our happiness trigger number 6 Connection. This one is one of my top three fav. I love the way we all seem to connect when we are together. Let's read this chapter before we meet and let's talk about what each of us do to keep connected with the ones we love. Do you have a monthly, weekly, or daily date with a family member or someone you love? What do you do? Where do you go and why?
Also I'd like to spend the last hour talking about the results of our HappyWomenTest.com. take it again if you gave been with the group for a while.
Between our discussions about the overall chapter, how we spend our time and our test results, that should take up our time together.
results.name: Happiness Trigger #6 Connection

results.description:
Please sign up if you're planning on playing and bring your favorite games!  Newbies are very welcome.  We have some great teachers to help you get started on your gaming adventure.  Let us know when you sign up what game(s) you'll be bringing.  On Sundays there is plenty of free parking on the side streets and even right on Murray.  Crazy Mocha serves great coffee, specialty drinks, snacks and pastries.  They do allow us to bring food in if we take our trash with us. We usually play all day, break for dinner around 6:00, then it's back to gaming until everybody poops out. 

Incidentally, many of our regular players no longer bother to sign up (but I really wish they would!), so if it looks like only  one or two people are coming, there could actually be quite a few more.  Remember, I will always cancel a game Meetup if we aren't gaming that day, so you won't be sitting there all by yourself waiting for a friend.    And please, remember to change your rsvp to no if you can't make it that day!

$1.00 will be charged to help cover the fee Meetup charges and to buy games for the group.  Join us and let the games begin!!!
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be the ones playing games.
results.name: Play Eurogames!

results.description:
Click Here


Take your sweetheart on a beautiful hike through Hartwood Acres with L.L.Bean Pittsburgh. This 629-acre preserve offers a scenic setting, including a stately Tudor Mansion, a stable complex and gate lodge. Please make sure you wear appropriate hiking clothing, waterproof footwear (if possible) and dress for the weather (layers; no cotton). Please bring a small day pack with extra clothes, snacks, water and any personal medications you may need. Plus a camera to take some memorable photos. Hope you can join us!


Thank you for your interest in our free "Sweetheart Hike Outing." L.L.Bean has a centralized reservation system. To guarantee your space, you must first confirm your reservation on our centralized reservation system, and if appropriate, fill out a participant agreement. Please visit www.llbean.com/pittsburgh, find this event on the "Event Calendar", and register. We look forward to seeing you!

Activity Level:
Physical Ability/Cardiovascular Demand: Easy
Level of Experience: Intro

Hike distance will be ~4 miles.

Learn the skills for a lifetime of adventure: 
  • L.L.Bean Outdoor Discovery Schools LLBean.com/Adventure 
</a>

What to bring:
Dress in Layers (avoid Cotton)
Hiking Boots or Shoes with Tread
Water to stay hydrated
Snacks
Completed and signed L.L.Bean participant agreement <a href="http://files.meetup.com/3349842/Participant_Agreement_Form_110514.pdf">Click Here

Optional: Optics, Lip Balm, Camera, Change of Shoes, Dry Bag, Walking Stick or Trekking Poles, Personal Medicines, Eye Protection

Minimum Age 8: This outing is open to ages 8 and above. Children 8 to 14 years of age need to be accompanied by a participating adult. Children 15 to 17 years old can participate alone after their parent has signed the L.L.Bean participant agreement for minors. 


Dog-friendly: Leashed (6' leash please), people friendly, vaccinated, well socialized outdoor dogs are welcome on the hike.

Need help preparing for your next adventure? Visit L.L.Bean Store at Ross Park Mall and ask to speak with an Outdoor Product Specialist. L.L.Bean will fit you with the right clothing and gear for all of life's adventures.

L.L.Bean Store at Ross Park Mall
1000 Ross Park Mall Drive (Map)
Pittsburgh, PA  15237
L.L.Bean Outdoor Discovery Schools
Website | Meetup | Twitter | Facebook
results.how_to_find_us: In Middle Road Parking Lot. Look for Black Ford Ranger

results.description:
Cruelty Free, Wholesome and Aphrodisiac

NOTE: One ticket admits TWO guests. See ticket link below.

Join Lean Chef en Route/ extraVEGANza Pgh for a romantic dinner, part of a series of monthly Around The World Pop-Up Dinners. Guests will be treated to culinary creations with worldly inspiration, culled with locally-grown, organic and GMO-free ingredients. The event features fun, food education and a multi-course dinner. 


Chef Mya Zeronis has a background in globally-inspired contemporary American cuisine, and her dinner series scored a Q & A in Pittsburgh Magazine, chef profile in Pittsburgh Post-Gazette and write-up by Pop City Media. This month, she will be serving up flavors of France, Pittsburgh, New York City, Italy, Mexico and India with her own modern flair, taking diners on a whirlwind delicious voyage. Themed for the Valentine's Day celebration, menu includes a variety of aphrodisiac ingredients that also are superfoods: cacao, avocado, banana, berries, cherries, pomegranate, pumpkin seeds, chilies, cinnamon, garlic and baby arugula.


This is reservation only event, and guests must pay in advance. Don't miss limited-time early RSVP discounted rate! NOTE: One ticket admits TWO guests.

The plant-based, multi-course supper includes both raw and cooked items that are free of gluten, soy, dairy, egg, honey and refined sugar.


1) Guests will learn to make ever so familiar Pittsburgh's stable pierogies the new way, using Weatherbury Farm's organic buckwheat (wholesome, gluten-free grain) and stuffing them with sweet potatoes and kale. We'll save finished masterpieces to be served with the entree as other food and beverages acompany:
2) Chai tea with cinnamon, fennel seeds, orange peels, turmeric, ginger, mint, cloves, sweetened with maple syrup (optional)
3) Roasted red bell pepper sherry bisque topped with a pair of nori hearts
4) Apple cider and herb marinated, thinly-sliced beet carpaccio served with baby arugula, avocado, pomegranate dressing
5) Baby bella mushroom artichoke ragout over kale-sweet potato-stuffed buckwheat pierogies pan fried with unrefined coconut oil and sprinkled with pine nut parmesan
6) Raw raw chocolate cashew cheese cake with cherry-strawberry compote, banana flambé
7) Raw Mexican hot chocolate with raw cacao, pumpkin seeds, cayenne, dried unsweetened coconut, raw brown sugar.


Please let organizer know well in advance if you have any food allergies and restrictions. 

Milestones:
Intercontinental Superfood Brunch I Edible Allegheny Magazine I Dec 2015
ExtraVEGANza offers Pittsburghers a slow food brunch l Pittsburgh City Paper l Nov 2015
Evolution of eating l Vegans Save The World l April 2015
Vegan brunch review l Muddy Melissa's Musings l April 2015
Best Brunch Winner l City Voter l Aug 2014
Munch goes to Schwartz Living Market l Pittsburgh Post-Gazette l Aug 2014
Try new foods l Wonderaddo l June 2014
A la carte: Mya Zeronis l Pittsburgh Magazine l Jan 2014
Cook and learn at pop-up dinner l Pittsburgh Post-Gazette l Sept 2013
From farm tables to city lots, it's a new scene in dining l Sept 2013

http://veganvalentinesdinner.brownpapertickets.com/

results.description:
Wow! Amy herself of Mon Aimee Chocolate has donated a chocolate Valentine's Day basket full of chocolate goodies. What are the odds of you winning the raffle? Well, With Jack M. now out of the running (forever), your chances are roughly 1 in 12.  Weathers gonna be warmer tomorrow, a balmy 21 degrees. Maybe you just might want to join us at Hambones for some uke playing. Think?

Ukulele players of all skill levels are invited to come and Jam at Hambone's Pub. Come to play ukulele, sing along, or even just to watch. We play from 5-7 pm.

I think you can guess the theme.  Bring your loved ones and you can serenade them with love songs!

Leader: Sunny

365 Yellow Book:

All My Loving 19

Can't help falling in love 51

Glory of love 90

Happy together 98

I cant give u anything but love 117

Love me tender 154

Love me do 154

366 Blue Book:
I just called to say i love you 155

It had to be u 192

L-o-v-e 230

You and I 397

You belong to me 399

You cant hurry love 401

Non book:
Drop baby drop

In spite of ourselves

She loves you (big beatles version)

Baby i love your way

Tonite You Belong to Me

Come earlier and sample Hambone's menu; meet other players over a beverage or just tune up. The beer is cold and the food is GREAT! Parking is free on Sundays and there is a small city lot across the street from Hambone's.

PS:   Sign up now to attend this "Jam."  See you at Hambone's.
results.how_to_find_us: We will be in Hambone's Dining Room (the door to the left)
results.name: 2nd Sunday Jams at Hambone's Pub

results.description:
Presented by: Play Dating, Speed Dating


No Couples Allowed!

Valentine’s Day not your favorite holiday (unless you’re coupled up)? Don’t hide out at home! Instead come “Play” with the hottest singles in Pittsburgh.

Dress to impress at this no pressure, fun event where everyone will be unattached, so no need to be shy or scan for rings.

No awkward conversations with strangers. No scrambling to come up with interesting things to talk about. Only genuine connections with fantastic people.

We’ve reserved a private space just for us, so keep an open mind.  Thanks you, and we can’t wait to “Play” with you!

Tickets: 

$20 Early Bird Until February 6th

$30 General Admission

$40 At The Door

Purchase Prepay Tickets Here: https://vdaybashpgh.eventbrite.com

WE'RE EXPECTING OVER 100 PITTSBURGH SINGLES SO GRAB YOUR TICKETS ASAP AND BRING A FRIEND!

We're also keeping track to make sure that this event is as close to an even male/female ratio as possible!


Tickets Include:

~ 1 Complimentary Drink & Appetizers

~ Prizes and Giveaways

~ Fun Games + a Mystery Date

Common Questions:

Can I come alone?

Yes 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.

What are the age ranges?

This event is open to singles of any age! Check out our Meetup Group Relationship Ready Singles - Pittsburgh for more coming events (http://www.meetup.com/relationship-ready-singles-burgh/ )

How is this different from other singles dating events?

The brainchild of matchmaker, Danita Walton, Play Dating is a unique dating concept centered around the premise of spontaneity, fun, and connection.

Should you meet your Mr. or Mrs. right we want you to be able to tell the story as if we were never there. So forget about meeting someone and just come out and have some fun!

Purchase Prepay Tickets Here: 

https://vdaybashpgh.eventbrite.com
results.name: 'No Couples Allowed' Valentine's Day Bash - Pittsburgh

results.description:
UPDATE:  Il y a encore un peu de place pour la séance du cinéclub ce dimanche soir.  


J'ai revu un peu le film - et il est toujours assez bouleversant.  en fait c'est l'histoire de deux accouchements - l'un qui n'aboutit pas et l'autre virtuel. Bien sûr c'est une interprétation personnelle - et il faudrait voir le film pour comprendre ce à quoi je fait allusion.

I usually do this Friday - but I am attending a book reading/signing by a Vietnamese author.  My apologies to those who normally come on Friday.  We are not obliged to do 37.2 le matin if many have already seen this.  Have you?  Please comment on the space below.

37.2 LE MATIN - is one of my all-time favorite films.  Jean-Jacques Beineix [pronounced "Ben-ex"] won a César for Best First Feature Film - and Jean-Hugues Anglade has the performance of a life time.   - so it was a break-out film for many people in many ways.  Béatrice Dalle is stunning, too.


Subtitles are in English (but can be turned off if everyone is a French speaker).


The allociné preview is here:

http://www.allocine.fr/film/fichefilm_gen_cfilm=90562.html

The Official youtube one is here:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YydulEgsTOE

<a href="http://www.allocine.fr/film/fichefilm_gen_cfilm=222259.html"></a>
results.how_to_find_us: You will get an email if you sign up.
results.name: Film: Un film d'amour peut-être?  venez voir 37.2 LE MATIN chez nous

results.description:
*** Movie shows at 8 pm, meet in the lobby by 7:45 to get seats****
------------------------
David Bowie made his unforgettable screen debut as the extraterrestrial humanoid who comes to Earth to get water for his drought-stricken planet. He starts a high technology company and soon becomes a fabulously wealthy industrialist with the billions of dollars he needs to build a return spacecraft. However, he does not count on the greed and ruthlessness of business here on Earth. Told in an eye-popping, nonlinear narrative style, with hypnotic visuals and a groovy 70s soundtrack, this cautionary tale’s message has not diminished with time. Get ready to have your mind blown. Originally cut by 20 minutes for its 1976 US release, this is the complete director’s cut.
results.name: David Bowie in The Man Who Fell to Earth

results.description:
2 Rules for the meet up:

1) No solicitation of services *cool if someone comes to you but consultants/lawyers/coaches beware, any sales pitches and you'll have to find a new Monday ritual

2) Make sure to state whether what you are saying is an opinion or fact (both very much welcome) so to not confuse anyone about where the point of view comes from

Location change: Repair The World - 6022 Broad St. (Around the corner from Zeke's Coffee - grab your coffee from there and head over)

Share or listen to ideas but don't be fooled this is not startup therapy or feeding the ego this is about getting to work and removing the obstacles to make your idea a reality.

All entrepreneurs are welcome and it's not uncommon for us to have musicians, artists, chefs, writers, developers, renovators, or just about anyone else you can think of join the conversation.
results.name: Get your ideas or business UNSTUCK!

venue.name: Meet outside Alpha Lab Gear / Thrill Mill / Repair the World

results.description:
Entrepreneurs helping each other. Bring your ideas, questions and experiences. Providing face-to-face help and feedback for your business in bite-sized chunks.

This meetup is right after the Unstuck Entrepreneur Meetup http://www.meetup.com/unstuckmondaymeetup/ which is right there at Repair the World from 8-9AM. Think about coming to BOTH!


After meeting outside in the lobby of Repair the World / Alpha Lab Gear / Thrill Mill, we adjourn upstairs to Alpha Lab Gear.

This meetup is run by an experienced entrepreneur who started a business, ran it for over 20 years and successfully exited to a public company. He now keeps busy mentoring for a nationally recognized accelerator, reviewing business plans/pitches for investors and consulting for businesses & non-profits. When asked “why do a meetup?” he says he is looking to “pay it forward” by helping people make less mistakes than he made.
results.name: Entrepreneur Monday Morning Roundtable - Entrepreneurs Helping Each Other

results.description:
Meditation Mondays! (SOUTHSIDE)

Every Monday at Southside Presbyterian Church.

Begin the week with the gentle practice of working with your mind. We'll begin our practice with a little yoga-inspired stretching and a reading from a variety of spiritual traditions (suggestions welcome!) and complete our practice with zazen - sitting meditation. This event is BYOC (Bring Your Own Cushion) until we can raise enough money to supply cushions for everyone.

Your donation will help pay for the space rental and go towards the purchase of cushions (zafus and zabutans). Donations accepted but not required to take part in these meditation sessions. Drop-ins welcome!

Every Monday beginning January 4th at South Side Presbyterian Church (1926 Sarah Street) in the former preschool room.

Feel free to join our facebook group for the latest event updates, links to resources and community sharing.

http://www.facebook.com/groups/921558924546578/


­
results.name: Meditation Mondays! (SOUTHSIDE)

venue.name: Quantum Counseling Services

results.description: There are four levels of understanding: 1. Thinking, 2. Believing, 3. Knowing, 4. Being. In the centuries after Jesus walked the earth, Christianity diverged down two distinctly differently pathways between "believing" and "knowing." Those who "believe" that they can come to "know" God by "being" God are known as Gnostics. This group examines Gnostic concepts and looks closely at the soul-stirring teachings of Jesus in the Gospel of Thomas. Understand this text by reading in the language of spirit and indeed you will have no doubt about your purpose on earth. Jesus even says so in the first verse of Thomas!
results.how_to_find_us: We are conveniently located in Cranberry Township at One Landmark North, Suite 205A, 20399 Perry Highway, Brandt Drive, Cranberry Township, PA 16066.
results.name: Level 27 - Gospel of Thomas: There's No Doubt About It!

group.name: Quantum CB/New Eyes: Exploring Your Infinite Possibilities

results.description:
Hi I'm Amber Bamber.  I go to most of these Open Mic's at Club Cafe on Monday's.  It's FREE! To enjoy, Music, Poetry, Comedy, Spoken Word and More and some top of the line Talent in Pittsburgh.  And Occasionally I host this event (and Sing)... but other awesome Pittsburgh Musicians do too!

Limiting the Event to 10 people including me, cause CLUB CAFE is a small venue and I've cross-posted it.

I make it to most of these but not all of these.  Say hi to me after I'm on stage. I usually sign up for a song or three.  Bring a friend if you want. 

***

Every Monday there is a Different Theme and a Different Host.

AcoustiCafe's open stage intends to create a supportive environment for artists to network with their peers, test new music or haul out old favorites and most importantly, extend their reach in the local scene. Signup at 7pm, 21+ no cover.

FREE admission! Pay for your own Food n Drinks!

ALWAYS CHECK to get the DETAILS of the events here on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/acousticafepgh
results.how_to_find_us: I'm Amber, I'm at most of these Open Mics but not all of them.
results.name: Acoustic Cafe at Club Cafe! FREE, Open Mic Night! Every Monday 7pm -11pm

results.description:
Join us and attend one or all six Practice of Happiness/Positive Psychology master classes. Each month you will learn how to experience more joy, fulfillment, satisfaction, and happiness by applying the six components of positive psychology to your everyday life.

Laura Parkinson, who has a master's degree in counseling psychology and 30 years' corporate training experience, will present these master classes. Each class will include enthusiastic mini-lectures, lively discussions, recommended readings, and useful application exercises.

Fell free to attend any one of the six classes. If you attend all six classes, you will receive the Library's Certificate of Completion. Both teens and adults are welcome to attend. No registration is required.

All classes are FREE.

These are the dates and topics of each class:

1. Introduction to the practice of happiness/positive psychology, and in-depth focus on increasing your vitality. Monday, 2/15, 7-8:30 pm, room A.

2. Increasing your vitality applications review, and in-depth focus on expressing your true values and experiencing greater meaning. Monday, 3/14, 7-8:30 pm, room A.

3. Expressing your true values and experiencing greater meaning applications review, and in-depth focus on setting, achieving, and celebrating meaningful personal goals. Monday, 4/18, 7-8:30 pm, room A.
results.name: Practice of Happiness/Positive Psychology Master Class Series Mt. Lebo Library!

group.name: Free and Almost Free in Pittsburgh

results.description: Patrick Keane is the founder of Walk Up Web, a consulting company in Pittsburgh that specializes in helping companies design their customer-centric microlocation strategy.  The primary technology we use is Bluetooth low-energy (BLE) beacons.  Patrick will present a technical overview of beacon technology, including Apple's iBeacon standard, and Google's Eddystone -- the emerging Physical Web standard. Participants will get to see and hear about a number of different practical applications for microlocation technology.  We'll compare and contrast a few different microlocation deployments, and there will be an opportunity for questions & answers at the end. Participants will also get an opportunity to see a number of different pieces of beacon hardware from different manufacturers.  Patrick will demonstrate HearMarked, an example of an iBeacon microlocation application. He will also walk through a live demonstration of Google's physical web standard, Eddystone.
results.name: A Beacons / Eddystone / Physical Web primer

venue.name: Unitarian Universalist Church of North Hills

results.description:
Come and play ukulele with us at the Unitarian Universalist Church of the North Hills on the first and third Mondays of each month. All levels of play are welcome, and we are novice-friendly. Some people who come have never even held a ukulele, and if you contact Sandy ahead of time, she will bring an extra ukulele for you to try. Try it -- it's fun!

Music is usually selected from "The Daily Ukulele... 365 Songs for Better Living," by Liz and Jim Beloff. This book is readily available at music stores, book stores, and Amazon.com. Sometimes members bring other music to play (bring 15 copies to share). We play in a circle, so bring a music stand if you have one  

Snacks and libations to share are welcome.

For more information, contact Sandy at [masked]

Directions to the Church: Take I279 North to Wexford exit. Turn right at the end of the exit. Right at the light onto Brandt School Road. Right onto West Ingomar Road to 2359. Note - watch for the large sign for the Church and then you will follow a narrow roadway back through the trees to the Church.

Depending on where you start, there may be a better route to the Church. Please check your GPS for different directions.
results.name: 3rd Monday in North Hills

results.description:
Come learn to waltz with us! The lesson starts at 7pm but please come early if you have not registered yet. No partner is required and any shoes are permitted as long as they are not muddy. This class is free but the rest of the series of 8 classes is $70 ($50 for participants under 30). This is the last week you can begin after that, registration is closed. 

If want to see some cool moves, stick around afterwards to watch the intermediate class from 8 to 9.
results.how_to_find_us: The community center is just off Braddock and has plenty of street parking. After you enter the building, take the stairs on the left down to the lower level and we're in the auditorium on your left.
results.name: Beginner Waltz Lesson

The Downtown & Business Branch hosts free movies on Tuesdays starting at 12:15 pm. Please join us for this week's film! Call[masked] for more information.

DVD, 128 Minutes

The Younger family, frustrated with living in their crowded Chicago apartment, sees the arrival of a $10,000 insurance check as the answer to their prayers. When the matriarch of the family puts a down payment on a house in an all-white suburban neighborhood and entrusts the balance of the money to her son, it causes a rift among family members. It soon takes the strength and integrity of this African-American family to battle against generations of prejudice to try to achieve their piece of the American Dream. Based on play by Lorraine Hansberry. Starring Sidney Poitier and Ruby Dee. (1961)
