results.description:
Join us on Tuesdays for American Mah Jong! Folks begin arriving around 5PM, and play begins table by table as soon as we have three or four players plus a set.  (We usually have 3-5 tables.)  By 6:15 or so, most players have arrived. We rotate among the tables... at the end of each game, East walks around to see if another table is close to the end of their game, so that two players can swap places.   At the other end of the evening... play must end by 9PM when Panera closes.  Tables begin wrapping up play any time after 8:15 or so.


If you have never played, or if you have not played for a very long time, we highly recommend that you take a Mah Jong 101 beginner class before playing with us - beginner classes are offered every few months.  Mah jong is a wonderful game, but it's hard to learn by just watching others play!


Please order your 2015 card from the National Mah Jongg League, here: http://www.nationalmahjonggleague.org/ Amazon.com also carries the cards. Note that you want the NMJL card, and no other! (There are some colorful alternatives out there.. but we play NMJL card and rules.)

Experienced players -- please bring your cards and please bring a set if you have one.

Please do not bring any outside food or beverages into Panera! Instead, please plan to buy *something* from Panera, even if it's just a beverage or a cookie, to support their willingness to host us.
results.how_to_find_us: Hard to miss us, look for the Mah Jong sets!
results.name: Mah Jong in Shadyside! (Beginner class also tonight!)

results.description:
We will gather at 5PM, and I will introduce you to the tiles, the card, and the game.  We usually have time for one or two games.

Please try to arrive on time for this class!


You will not need your own Mah Jong card tonight.... but if you are going to continue playing, you should order a 2015 card! (The card changes April 1 every year - let me know if you have trouble finding a 2015 card.) You do not need to buy a Mah Jong set - they are not inexpensive, and we have plenty of sets.


We can eat while I'm going through the basics, so feel free to grab some food when you arrive at Panera.

I request a $10 fee for the beginner class -- payable at the beginning of the class.  If that is a problem for you, just let me know.  There is no charge for the weekly meetups ... only the classes.


Any questions?  You can reach me through the meetup group, or email me through the Pittsburgh Mah Jong web site:  http://pittsburghmahjong.com/contact/
results.how_to_find_us: Look for Mah Jong tiles on the table!
results.name: Mah Jong 101 - intro for beginners

results.description:
Please ask at the host stand for the book club. We are usually in the back room against the windows, but you never know...

I missed everyone this month! For February, the group chose The Husband's Secret by Liane Moriarty. I'm excited to read this one - i've liked the others we have read by her.

From Amazon.com:

Australian author Moriarty, in her fifth novel (after The Hypnotist's Love Story), puts three women in an impossible situation and doesn't cut them any slack. Cecilia Fitzpatrick lives to be perfect: a perfect marriage, three perfect daughters, and a perfectly organized life. Then she finds a letter from her husband, John-Paul, to be opened only in the event of his death. She opens it anyway, and everything she believed is thrown into doubt. Meanwhile, Tess O'Leary's husband, Will, and her cousin and best friend, Felicity, confess they've fallen in love, so Tess takes her young son, Liam, and goes to Sydney to live with her mother. There she meets up with an old boyfriend, Connor Whitby, while enrolling Liam in St. Angela's Primary School, where Cecilia is the star mother. Rachel Crowley, the school secretary, believes that Connor, St. Angela's PE teacher, is the man who, nearly three decades before, got away with murdering her daughter—a daughter for whom she is still grieving. Simultaneously a page-turner and a book one has to put down occasionally to think about and absorb, Moriarty's novel challenges the reader as well as her characters, but in the best possible way. Agent: Faye Bender, Faye Bender Literary Agency. (Aug.)
results.why: We love to read, drink wine and talk about books!

results.description:
Embody Healing, LLC's monthly meetup allows people to do (meditative style) shamanic journey work together to have and share experiences, grow together, and have a sense of community with others engaged in their own spiritual growth and self healing. We request a $5 donation from those who can give to cover costs of the meetup, but you are more than welcome to come even if you are unable to donate. Each month we set an alter, welcome in the energies, share a journey or two, and release the energy. You are welcome to participate in the journey planned or to do your own journey work during the time we are journeying as a group. After the journey we have a quiet time for people to record their experiences if they choose to do so and then you are given an opportunity to share if you would like to (sharing is never required). You are recommended to have basic journey skills prior to the meetup as this is not a 101 class (if you would like to host a 101 class, get in touch with me to arrange it! I offer them when I get enough community interest- usually every 6-12 months. You may also develop this skill elsewhere, the 101 class is not a required pre-requisite for the meetup).

The space is set, cleansed and protected before people arrive. You will be given a blessing and cleansing when you arrive prior to entering the space. Then the schedule proceeds as follows:

7pm door opens. If you come between 7:10 and 7:35 please wait in the waiting area while we build the alter.

7-7:25 alter building (feel free to bring something that reflects one of the elements if you wish to)

7:35 Door is locked, first journey starts

7:35-8:30, however many journeys the group feels like doing.

I am again going to diffuse appropriate oils for this meetup as it is still a bit dry for the smoke and folks are really lovin on the oils! If you have an allergy or sensitivity, please let me know so I can plan accordingly.

This day in Aztec calendar lore is "signifies tenacity, rejuvenation, that which cannot be uprooted forever. Malinalli is a day for persevering against all odds and for creating alliances that will survive the test of time." It also comes during a 13 day cycle that carries the energy of creating order out of chaos, and establishing new from the energy of the old.

It will be a great day to travel to various beings you have been working with in the other realms and helping to establish those relationships.

Hope to see you there! Feel free to message me (Rebekah Gamble, Holistic Practitioner) with questions or concerns at [masked]
results.name: February Monthly Journeying Meetup Group

results.description:
Young Croatian cellists Luka Sulic and Stjepan Hauser, together known as 2CELLOS, have achieved international success by taking the cello to a new level with their incredible talent and undeniable passion. Their playing style has broken down the boundaries between different genres of music, from classical and film music to pop and rock. 2CELLOS have no limits when it comes to performing live and are equally as impressive when playing Bach and Vivaldi as they are when rocking out to AC/DC and Iron Maiden.

2CELLOS have also been featured on several TV shows including Glee and The Bachelor.

There are also many 2CELLOS videos, such as

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Mx0xCI1jaUM

For more information about 2CELLOS, please visit http://www.2cellos.com and https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2Cellos

Check out this article where Pittsburgh Magazine includes the 2CELLOS concert as one of 'Pittsburgh's 5 Can’t Miss Concerts in February' http://www.pittsburghmagazine.com/Pittsburgh-Magazine/February-2016/Pittsburghs-5-Cant-Miss-Concerts-in-February/

TICKETS Regular tickets range from about $32-$52 (depending on how close you'd like to sit to the stage) which can be bought by visiting or calling the Theater Square Box Office [masked]) or going online http://trustarts.culturaldistrict.org/production/47018 

There are also VIP Ticket Packages that also include a meet & greet, autographed merchandise, etc. http://trustarts.culturaldistrict.org/pct_home/ticketpages/2cellos-vip/

In terms of planning the Meetup, there are several options:

 1) We could plan to meet before the concert at the nearby Backstage Bar (655 Penn Avenue) to have a drink, quick dinner, and enjoy some free live jazz (featuring local jazz pianist Joseph Sheehan) from about 6:30-7:30 PM and then walk 1/2-block together over to the Benedum.  For more information about the Backstage Bar (including the menu), please visit http://trustarts.org/visit/facilities/backstage/

2) If the 2CELLOS doesn't sell out in advance, then we could buy tickets at the door for those that wish to sit together.

3) Of course, it is also fine for those that wish to buy their own seats in advance and then they could also meet the group at the Backstage Bar before the concert.

However, we'll monitor the situation and post updates as far as ticket options.

As always, it is also fine if you'd like to attend this concert on your own with family/friends instead.

Stay tuned for updates!

Parking Here is the ParkPGH website with real-time info on downtown parking garage availability http://parkpgh.org where you can also download apps, get garage availability via text messaging, etc. You can also call[masked]-8980.
results.how_to_find_us: People have the option to meet beforehand at the nearby Backstage Bar (655 Penn Avenue) to have a drink/quick dinner with free live jazz from about 6:30-7:30 PM -- but everyone in the group should meet in the Benedum Box Office at 7:30 PM.
results.name: 2CELLOS Concert

results.description:
Join us for a 2-hour session of indoor volleyball open gym! You'll get a ton of playing time in a well-organized event. Our host will check players in, divide players into teams, and make sure that everything runs smoothly. All you have to do is show up ready to play!

Pricing:

• $7 - RSVP online and pay in advance (online rsvp closes at 4:30 pm!)

• $9 - RSVP and pay cash at the event

• $10 - Show up and play - be sure to check online to make sure there is room!

What to Wear: We are playing indoors on a rubberized all-sport surface. Most players wear volleyball-specific shoes, but gym shoes are also allowed. Please bring your shoes and change into them at the facility. This will help keep the floor clean of dirt and water.

What to Expect: Show up early! The games will begin at the time posted for this event. Players can start checking in with the event host as early as 15 minutes before the scheduled start time. If a court is available, you may begin warming up before the event begins. We limit play to 42 players per evening, which is 3 teams of 7 players per court. If we have 3 teams on a court, winners stay once and then shuffle out so everyone gets to play. If less people are in attendance, we divide based on who is there and mix things up half way through the session.

Level of Play: This event is open to all levels of play. We do our best to create even teams so that games are well-matched. Our ideal scenario is having one court of higher skilled players and one court of more recreational players. There are no referees, so players need to play with sportsmanship and make their own calls. We aim to make everyone feel welcome at these events.

Facility Information: Monroeville Sports Center is located at 855 Macbeth Drive in Monroeville. Parking should be ample in the free lot.

Minimum number of players and playing formats. This event needs a minimum of 12 people (not including the host) signed up before the start of the event in order to run. An email notification will be sent if we cancel. Refunds or credits will be issued if we cancel the event. Sign up early to encourage more people to sign up!!

Do Your Part! Help us keep an accurate guest count! If you RSVP, we're counting on you to be there. If you change your mind about playing or your guest count changes, please update your RSVP. No-Shows will be marked on your account. If space is tight, we hold RSVP spots 10 minutes into advertised start and then open spots to walk-ups.

Requirements to play: This is an adult volleyball group. You must be 19 older. Males and females of all skill levels are welcome to play. There is no required gender ratio. Players are expected to conduct themselves with good sportsmanship.

What's included in the price? Your payment helps to cover the rental costs, the hourly pay for your event host, and ensures a well-organized event.

Questions? Post your question in the comments section of this meetup and the event host or one of our organizers will reply. You can also message the organizers directly through meetup. Or, give us a call M-F 8:00am-12:30pm:[masked]-7130.

Looking to find new growth strategies to increase revenue? Come to my Meetup and ask any questions you have about starting a business, running a business or being an entrepreneur. I want to help people and businesses become the best versions of themselves by making better decisions when it comes to business. I have found, as a business attorney and consultant, sometimes entrepreneurs and business owners just need someone to answer some basic questions to help them get out of their own way.  That is why I started this.

Each Meetup will be limited to 10 curious entrepreneurs and will last about an hour to an hour and a half.  Obviously, I cannot provide an legal advice at these Meetups, but I am happy to provide any business guidance you may need.  Hopefully the conversation will be good and the questions will be flowing. results.description:
About the Session:

Some of us work in an environment that must comply with federal, state or local regulations. In the past, such regulations were considered barriers to adopting a more agile approach. There are even instances where agile is deemed incompatible with regulated environments.

Those days are quickly changing!

Today, several regulated companies - public and private- operate in an agile manner similar to their non-regulated counterparts. 

In this talk, Mark Fern, a technology leader in a large, regulated financial institution, will guide us through a discussion about the contrasts and similarities to agile in such an organization. 

This session is part presentation, but largely a guided discussion regarding the agile experience from a different perspective.

About the Speaker:

Mark Fern is an experienced IT manager, with a strong background in software development and quality assurance. The past 3 years have found him leading teams and delivering value at PNC. He has personally undergone an agile transformation for his team and likes to share his experience of the journey.

He can be found on LinkedIn at: linkedin.com/in/mfern


About OpenArc, February's meetup sponsor:

OpenArc is an award-winning source for customized software development, collaborative problem solving and IT consulting services.  They are highly involved in the technology community and would love to interact with you at openarc.net

We look forward to seeing everyone there!
results.name: February Meetup: Agile in a Regulated Environment

results.description: The "Incito Veritas" founding fathers (which included females, of course, as no soul has a gender) originally called this group "Fight Club" and first intended to keep that name while maintaining secrecy. So much for that. But the spirit of Fight Club remains, the idea of trying to bring out the best in each other through the evolution of consciousness. As Brad Pitt said about the movie, "Fight Club is a metaphor for the need to push through the walls we put around ourselves and just go for it." And not fear the pain! In this meetup we discuss ways that concepts introduced during the Incito Veritas series can be applied to our daily lives. We will learn and grow as we process our experiences. Bottom line: Knowing and Not Doing is Not Knowing, or as it says in James 2:26, "For as the body without the spirit is dead, so faith without works is dead."

results.description:
The primary campaigns starts now.  Election day is April 26th.

In the past during phone banks, volunteers were first asked to each call 10 Bernie volunteers signed up with national.  When we we compared those names to our 900+ people on our Meetup group and our local email list -- once, 8 people weren't on our list.  Every other time either 9 or 10 people weren't in touch with our local activities.  Which means that there are thousands of people nearby who have told berniesanders.com that they are supporters and who don't even know that we are campaigning here for Bernie.

If Bernie is going to win here we need to reverse those numbers.  Activate all the local Bernie volunteers.  Get them on street corners, passing out flyers and talking up Bernie -- especially in black neighborhoods.  Going door to door to reach registered Democrats.  Hitting the universities and getting all the unregistered Bernie supporters registered.  Holding events indoors that will fire people up and educate them about Bernie.

So......from now until the primary here we will be calling those local volunteers, adding their names, phone numbers and email to our contact lists.  Expanding our base of workers.

Please join us!
results.how_to_find_us: In Oakland, directly across from Pitt Law School.
results.name: Bernie Phones Local Volunteers

results.description:
Code & Supply is promoting PittMesh Working Group's third and final WiFi basics class. Check out the event description below:

Technology, sufficiently advanced, is indistinguishable from magic. - Arthur C. Clarke's Third Law.


Now that we have covered basic RF behavior and how to calculate signal strength of a link, it is time to take our knowledge into the field and apply what we've learned to the real world. First, we're going to review the basics of RF Behavior.

Second, We will discuss RF Behavior on a large scale in the real world: 

• Visual Line of Sight 

• RF Line of Sight 

• Fresnel Zones 

• Earth Bulge 


Finally, we will teach you the advanced techniques you need to combat poor signal strength! We will discuss the dark arts of WiFi! 

• Band Steering 

• The Hidden Node Problem and RTS/CTS 

• Antenna Polarization 

• Antenna Diversification 

• Transmit Beamforming 

• Spatial Multiplexing 

• MIMO 

• MU-MIMO


With this knowledge you will have everything you need to create strong, long distance links and ensure good connectivity of client devices on your WiFi networks!


Want Pizza? Bring 5 WHOLE DOLLAR BILLS and we'll get you in on a 'za run. PLEASE RSVP IN THE COMMENTS about the Pizza so we can get the appropriate amount. Please also tell us if you are NOT going to have any.
results.name: WiFi Basics 3: RF Behavior on Planet Earth and the Dark Arts of WiFi

results.description:
Climb the Cathedral of Learning Stairs for an Hour, then Lulu's Noodles!

Meet at 6:50pm by the benches by the 1st Floor Cathedral of Learning Elevators. We climb the Back Stairwell (Stairwell A) starting exactly at 7pm, then climb as many floors as we can in a hour taking the elevator DOWN to rest and do it again. Couch Potatoes can usually do it 1-2 times people that are in shape can do it 3-5 times, super shape 4-7 times. Then we walk to Lulu's Noodles on South Craig Street and catch a bite because we earned it!

GREAT FOOD: Lulu's Noodles address: 300 South Craig Street  (great soups, bubble teas and mixed asian fare).

Parking is on street, FREE after 6pm on S. Bellefield, S. Craig and S. Dithridge Streets.

Wear light clothing and put coats on 36th floor and keep your valuables on you. Water Bottle or Camelback recommended.  It gets HOT in the Stairwells!

FYI: I just formed my CHARITY STAIR CLIMB TEAM for the Fight for Air Stair Climb Challenge!   The Team is UPHILL ALL THE WAY! AND I NEED PEOPLE TO JOIN THE STAIR CLIMBING TEAM.   We climb One Oxford Center which is 45 Stories = 1.3 Cathedrals of Learning (pretty easy).  If interested click on UPHILL ALL THE WAY! and click on JOIN TEAM.  I'm using the Cathedral Climbs for TRAINING!  Fight for Air Stair Climb is Sat. March 19th!

For month of Feb. will be climbing on WEDNESDAYS for Month of March will be climbing on TUESDAYS!

My phone for TEXT contact is[masked] remember I will be driving in from 40 mins away so will respond after my car is parked!

results.description:
I am thinking of bringing comic texts and songs today.  I have quite a number of standup routines, jokes, etc.  Humor in another culture is very tricky. I love the dark side of French comedy.

Update:  I will bring materials and try to structure this session a bit more.  

This is a discussion group EN FRANCAIS for those (intermediate and higher) wishing to perfect their conversational French.

I will bring materials for learning/teaching.  This will include 1 song, but there will also be a chapter from:

• La grammaire à l'oeuvre (John Barson-Stanford) - many consider to be the best grammar/conversation book ever written (I have French friends who use it for review).  John Barson was interested in using science fiction, art and other unusual 'gaming' techniques in perfecting grammar and expression.


• Le français Départ/Arrivée (Rassias - Dartmouth) - another classic text.  Rassias was by nature a theater person, and originator of a unique language learning method - very much "in your face" and physical-response oriented.


I will also focus on practicing authentic French phrases and pronunciation.

I say this, because many Americans have reached a plateau in their language learning - and this is totally normal.  BUT in order to progress to the next level, some heavy lifting is in order. 

Homework (reading, writing, listening) will be assigned, also.

results.description:
This Event
Congratulations! You've become a leader or are considering becoming a leader, now you can get your ideas listened to, and people finally take you seriously. You will be able to make an impact and influence decisions as well as have personal career growth. But before you put on your super leader cape and start saving people and projects, there's something you need to know. Something that most leadership books and gurus will either gloss over won’t tell you at all. Something that will shift your perspective, temper your idealism, and keep your leadership centered and that is Leadership is awfully hard. But it does’ need to be difficult, 

Imran, a UX leader, will discuss the ins and outs of what it means to be a UX leader, how can you grab leadership role and win. He will lay out some practical guidance and share some of his own lessons learned during his stints as a leader. This will be an interactive discussions on how to improve ourselves as a leader, regardless of where we have to play that role.

About Imran
Imran Riaz is a passionate and experienced UX leader. He is currently leading the UX group for ANSYS, a multi-Billion dollar software company based right here in Pittsburgh. In his current role he manages a diverse and multi-disciplinary team for Design Research, Product Design and Experience Strategy practices. 

He has been working in the software industry for over 20 years with emphasis on great user experience but also has been promoting UX discipline itself. With that purpose in mind in 2010, Imran founded Midwest UX conference to promote UX leadership and local UX in the Midwest area. He also served as Director North America for UXPA. He was the founding member and President of UXPA Columbus chapter. 

In his spare time he focuses on volunteering for promotion of educational and other worthy causes. He is a UX leader with local presence and lives with his family here in the Pittsburgh area. He is willing to help anyone to promote UX. You can follow Imran on Twitter @DocUX where he tweets about UX and leadership.

Join Us
This event will be held at The Art Institute of Pittsburgh. Fourth floor, room 439. Tell the security guards you are there for UX Pittsburgh. There is a parking garage available across the street from the school and street parking is free after 6pm.
results.name: UX Leadership

results.description:
Please join us for a free screening of the thought-provoking film A Place at the Table, a well-reported documentary (starring Jeff Bridges) about the state of hunger in America  which will be followed by a Q&A discussion with the Greater Pittsburgh Community Food Bank.  This free screening is presented as part of Duquesne University's 2016 Human Rights Film Series (during January 21 - February 25, 2016) which is now in its 9th year showcasing powerful films that address important issues. For a listing of all 6 films (and panelists) for this year's series, please visit http://www.duq.edu/academics/schools/liberal-arts/2016-human-rights-film-series

Check out the video trailer

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cgxxT4xpVNI

This film is 84 minutes long and is rated PG.

Official film site: http://www.magpictures.com/aplaceatthetable/

For more information about this film, please visit http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1736049/

For reviews and articles about A Place at the Table, please visit http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/a_place_at_the_table_2013/

http://www.pbs.org/newshour/rundown/with-50-million-hungry-in-us-new-film-calls-for-a-place-at-the-table/

Please Note: While this event is free, all attendees are encouraged to bring one or more food items to the showing of the film as part of a campus-wide food drive in support of the Greater Pittsburgh Community Food Bank. (No glass please.) Click here for details and recommended items to donate.


For more information about this film screening, please visit http://www.duq.edu/academics/schools/liberal-arts/2016-human-rights-film-series/schedule-and-speakers/place-at-the-table

About the Film - A Place at the Table


50 million people in the U.S.-one in four children-don't know where their next meal is coming from, despite our having the means to provide nutritious, affordable food for all Americans. Directors Kristi Jacobson and Lori Silverbush examine this issue through the lens of three people who are struggling with food insecurity: Barbie, a single Philadelphia mother who grew up in poverty and is trying to provide a better life for her two kids; Rosie, a Colorado fifth-grader who often has to depend on friends and neighbors to feed her and has trouble concentrating in school; and Tremonica, a Mississippi second-grader whose asthma and health issues are exacerbated by the largely empty calories her hardworking mother can afford.


Their stories are interwoven with insights from experts including sociologist Janet Poppendieck, author Raj Patel and nutrition policy leader Marion Nestle; ordinary citizens like Pastor Bob Wilson and teachers Leslie Nichols and Odessa Cherry; and activists such as Witness to Hunger's Mariana Chilton, Top Chef's Tom Colicchio and Oscar®-winning actor Jeff Bridges.


Ultimately, A Place at the Table shows us how hunger poses serious economic, social and cultural implications for our nation, and that it could be solved once and for all, if the American public decides-as they have in the past-that making healthy food available and affordable is in the best interest of us all.

Please Note: All attendees are encouraged to bring one or more food items to the showing of the film as part of a campus-wide food drive in support of the Greater Pittsburgh Community Food Bank. (No glass please.) Click here for details and recommended items to donate.

About the Panelist Q&A Discussion following the Film

Speaker: Cynthia Moore, Educational Programs, Greater Pittsburgh Community Food Bank

About the Duquesne University 2016 Human Rights Film Series To check out all of the films (and panelists) scheduled for this film series, please visit http://www.duq.edu/academics/schools/liberal-arts/2016-human-rights-film-series

For a listing of films screened in previous years under this series, please visit http://www.duq.edu/academics/schools/liberal-arts/2016-human-rights-film-series/previous-films

As always, it is also fine if you wish to attend this event on your own with family and friends instead. This film may provide great opportunities for further discussion. 

Campus Parking http://www.duq.edu/admissions-and-aid/undergraduate-admissions/schedule-a-visit/parking-guide

For more information about this film screening, please visit http://www.duq.edu/academics/schools/liberal-arts/2016-human-rights-film-series/schedule-and-speakers/place-at-the-table

And for a printable campus map (where you can see that College Hall is Building #35 in the middle of the campus), please visit http://www.duq.edu/Documents/about/_pdf/Campus%20Map%20Legend%2010.15.pdf

results.description:
The Pittsburgh Change Ringing Guild meets regularly on Thursday nights to practice and hone our change ringing skills.

Non-ringers are welcome to attend Thursday night practices to come check out what we do.  When entering the tower, the most important rule is DO NOT touch the ropes unless specifically instructed to by an experienced bell ringer.  If people are currently ringing the bells when you walk in the room, please come in quietly and have a seat around the edges of the room.  We will stop ringing in a few minutes, and can give you an introduction to the bells.

Non-Ringers can also have an opportunity to try pulling the bell under the guidance of an experienced bell ringer.  We are also more than happy to teach you the ancient art of bell ringing.
Learning to ring the bells does take some time before you would be able to ring comfortably on your own.  Obviously the more effort you put into it the more quickly you would be able to ring confidently on your own.  You can expect 4-6 weeks of individual instruction to get to that stage.  And then once you learn how to handle the bells, that opens up a lifetime of ringing opportunities!

Check out the videos below to see what the bell ringing is like, and you are more than welcome to come join us for our practice night!  Please RSVP if you are coming, because practices sometimes get cancelled for various reasons.

Bells swinging: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=liuRptmR088 
Ringers pulling ropes: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M1vSfNF7OfI

results.description:
Hello everyone!

If you are reading this you probably at least have a passing interest in this new modern board gaming fad. 

If you are under the impression that we play games like Monopoly, Risk, Clue, and Candyland you are in for a rude awakening.

Modern board gaming is experiencing growth like crazy!  Not only with the number of people playing games but also with the number of new releases every year.  Can you believe there were over 700 new games released last year and that number is expected to rise even more this year. 

Even relatively new modern board games that you might have heard of like Settlers of Catan is now over twenty years old and another modern classic Ticket to Ride is over ten.  We still play and enjoy the older modern games but it is primarily because the companies keep them fresh by offering expansions to the regular content.  When was the last time you saw a content update to Monopoly or Risk?

Today's board games come in all different shapes, sizes, themes, components, and our group plays all kinds.. Here are some examples of the types of games we play...

Party games like:  Codenames, Spyfall, and Dixit.

Euro style games like:  Five Tribes, Orleans, Puerto Rico, Viticulture, and Lords of Waterdeep. 

Abstract games like:  Qwirkle, Blokus, and Hive

Card games like:  Dominion, Glory to Rome, Diamonds, and Munchkin

Those are just a few of the games that can be seen being played at our meetups every week.

Our members come in all shapes and sizes and span from young to older but all seem to have a great time when we get together!

Our organizers try to be very accommodating to new players and try to pick games appropriate to your skill level and that we think you would enjoy.  Our goal is to get you enthusiastic about the hobby.

If there is a game that you would like to try out just r.s.v.p. to one of our meetups and suggest it down in the chat.  Chances are that one of us has it in our collection and we can bring it out.

Look forward to introducing the hobby to many more players in 2016 and continued good times with our regulars.

Please r.s.v.p. early so I have an idea on how many people or coming and what games to bring along.  You can always cancel your r.s.v.p. if you have a change of plans.


See you soon!

Russ.

results.description:
Molly Hallberg is a thirty-nine-year-old divorced writer living in New York City who wants her own column, a Wikipedia entry, and to never end up in her family’s Long Island upholstery business. For the past four years Molly’s been on staff for an online magazine, covering all the wacky assignments. She’s snuck vibrators through security scanners, speed-dated undercover, danced with the Rockettes, and posed nude for a Soho art studio.

Fearless in everything except love, Molly is now dating a forty-four-yearold chiropractor. He’s comfortable, but safe. When Molly is assigned to write a piece about New York City romance “in the style of Nora Ephron,” she flunks out big-time. She can’t recognize romance. And she can’t recognize the one man who can go one-on-one with her, the one man who gets her. But with wit, charm, whip-smart humor, and Nora Ephron’s romantic comedies, Molly learns to open her heart and suppress her cynicism in this bright, achingly funny novel.

results.description:
INTERNATIONAL KUNDALINI YOGA TEACHER TRAINER PROGRAM
LEVEL I INSTRUCTOR: FOUNDATIONS
Pittsburgh, PA, USA

ORGANIZED BY: Golden Temple Academy
TRAINERS: Khartar Singh (Lead Trainer)
Guru Purkh Sing, M.D. (Associate Teacher)
In collaboration with Mookshi Wellness Center


The KRI Level One Aquarian Teacher Training Program is a 220-hour professional certification program in Kundalini Yoga as taught by Yogi Bhajan ®. An interactive course in the theory, practice, and basic skills of a Kundalini Yoga instructor, it includes 180 hours of classroom instruction and 40 hours of independent study: service projects, a 40-day meditation, and White Tantric Yoga. Graduates of Level One earn the title of KRI Certified Instructor of Kundalini Yoga as taught by Yogi Bhajan® and fulfill the Yoga Alliance RYT (Registered Yoga Teacher) 200-hour requirement. Foundations introduces the student to the principles and practices of the self-sensory human, and explores how Kundalini Yoga and yogic lifestyle can harmonize and uplift the human experience and awaken your true potential.

COMPONENTS IN THE LEVEL ONE PROGRAM:

1. Kriya and Meditation: The foundation of Kundalini Yoga as taught by Yogi Bhajan® The theory and practice of Kundalini Yoga kriyas (yoga sets), asanas, and mudras. Explore the nature of the mind and its training through Kundalini Yoga meditations, mantras, and pranayam (breathing techniques).
2. Humanology and Philosophy: The Lifestyle of a Kundalini Yoga Teacher The history and tradition of Kundalini Yoga, as well as the underlying philosophy behind all yogic practices. The technologies of Kundalini Yoga as they apply to healing and humanology (the science of daily living), including diet, nutrition, and relationships.
3. Anatomy & Physiology: Essentials of Yogic and Functional Anatomy Traditional Western anatomy, its purpose and function, including the respiratory, nervous, immune, musculoskeletal, circulatory, endocrine, and digestive systems and their relation to the practice and teaching of yoga. Also Yogic anatomy and the energy systems of the body including the chakras, nadis, pranas and vayus, and the ten yogic bodies.
4. Consciousness of a Teacher: Virtues and Values of Living in the Golden Chain The skills and techniques to become an effective instructor, including practical strategies for teaching beginners, ethical guidelines, curriculum development, and the transformational role of the teacher in developing a successful yoga practice.
5. The Master’s Touch: Cultivating a Connection to the Master Connect with Yogi Bhajan through DVD classes and study.
6.The Practicum: Teaching from Day One Practical experience instructing a yoga class under the supervision of a KRI Yoga Teacher Trainer, receiving written evaluation and student feedback.
MODULES

YOGA BASICS. What is Yoga - yoga varieties - Brief History of Yoga. Age of Aquarius – Golden Chain- Spiritual Master - Sutras of Patanjali.

BREATHING & KRIYA. Yogic breathing-pranayam; breathing frequency; breath benefits; retention; Breath of Fire; types of pranayam. The Kriya, Asanas, Bandhas, Mudras, the navel, relaxation.

LIFE & YOGIC SADHANA. Discipline, Attitude and Mastery- Mantras of the Age of Aquarius. Yogic Lifestyle. Mind and meditation. Basic characteristics of the mind; balanced mind; prayer and meditation; types of meditation NAAD YOGA - Yoga Mantras calm your mind and guide you in the research into new states of consciousness.

POSITIONS & ALIGNMENT. The navel point. The geometry of the position; bhandas refining; tips for teaching positions.

YOGA PHILOSOPHY. The concepts that define this style of life, their answers to the meaning of life and their vision of the universe around us.

YOGIC ANATOMY. The Tatwas; the Nadis and Kundalini; The chakras or energy vortices; ten spiritual bodies.

HUMANOLOGY. Man-Woman and relationships. Karma and Dharma. Death and Reincarnation. The cycles of success and prosperity. Conscious communication.

IDENTITY OF A TEACHER. Fundamental laws; Definition; Golden Chain; the perfect teachers; code of ethics.


REQUIREMENTS FOR KRI LEVEL ONE INSTRUCTOR CERTIFICATION

Full payment of the required fees.
Attending fully the teaching clases of the course
Participate at least 10 group Sadhanas morning.
Receive a satisfactory evaluation of the practicum.
Complete tasks at home and in class
Approve all oral or written examinations on the subjects covered in class.
40 hours of homework assigned (exclusive study guide, reading Japji Sahib, Bhagavad Gita, Yoga Sutras of Patanjali, complete view of Master Touch Yogi Bhajan DVD collection).
Create two examples of teaching programs (projects).
Complete a series of yoga / meditation for 40 days with a written diary.
Attend 20 classes KRI Kundalini Yoga teacher during the course and before completion.
Attend a full day of White Tantric Yoga
Properly represent and sign the Code of Professional Ethics for Teachers of Kundalini Yoga.
Participate in online events: webinar tutoring, group meetings, and virtual classrooms.

COURSE DAYS:
February 19,20,21 (Guru Purkh)
Mar 4, 5,6 (Guru Purkh)
Apr 1,2, 3 (Guru Purkh)
May 6,7, 8 (Guru Purkh)
June Retreat 9-13 (Kartar)
July 1,2,3 (Kartar)

CLASSES SCHEDULE

*each week there will be a Kundalini Yoga class on Wednesdays from 5:30-6:30pm

PRICE OF THE COURSE:
Application Fee (applicable towards total price of the course): $250
One time payment (after application fee): $2,750 (includes retreat) =$3,000
Monthly payment( after application fee): $750 initial payment+ 5 monthly payments of $450 = $3,250 (includes retreat)
***Registration required by Feb.15th, 2016
Please address any additional questions to [masked] or call[masked]

INCLUDED:
All collective teaching.
Book and Manual "Aquarian Teacher".
Examination fees.
Tutor online.
Golden Temple Academy assessments and certification.
Retreat lodging.

DOES NOT INCLUDE:
White Tantric Yoga.
Travel and subsistence expenses of the retreat.
Books and videos of Yogi Bhajan reading.
Final evaluation and rights of international KRI certificate (Kundalini Research Institute) and Kundalini Yoga instructor level 1.


TEACHERS

Guru Purkh Singh

MD, PhD, Pulmonologist.
Associate Professor of Kundalini Yoga (certified by KRI, IKYTA and AEKY).
Vice-chair of Spanish Association of Theraputhic Yoga (AEYT)

Kartar Singh

Teacher and Yoga Teacher Trainer with more than 30 years of experience.
Graduate of the most prestigious institutions KRI yoga, AEKY, IKYTA and Yoga Alliance.
Director of the Golden Temple Academy, Barcelona, Spain.

results.description:
"Psychosis"­  - free play at CMU at Purnell Center for Arts

Friday, Feb 20th! 7:45pm

"Psychosis" is the story of a woman who feels the weight of the world on her shoulders. As the small comforts of her life turn sour, she becomes stuck in a loop of guilt and paranoia. Like many of us, she wants to take on the world but is held back by her own inner struggles.
    
The play is ultimately a study on the way clinical depression can alter one's perspective on reality.
     
This is free! It is at John Wells Video Studio, at the Purnell Center for the Arts, on CMU campus (close to Forbes Ave, near Morewood Ave ).
   
We can meet in the lobby around 7:40. 
      
The CMU garage on Forbes ave may be free on Friday night. I know that it is free on weekends.

results.description:
What:: GASP Games Day 
Where:: Springdale United Presbyterian Church 
When:: 10am to 11pm 
Cost:: $5 (first time attendees are free)

Due to our situation in finding a new home, Games Days are currently on a month-2-month schedule. See below for the schedule, it will be updated as needed.

2016 Dates


• January 30th - Springdale United Presbyterian Church 

• February 20th - Springdale United Presbyterian Church

• March 12th - Springdale United Presbyterian Church

• April - Date and Location TBD

• May - Date and Location TBD

• June - Date and Location TBD

• July - Date and Location TBD

• August - Date and Location TBD

• September - Date and Location TBD

• October - Date and Location TBD

• November - Date and Location TBD

• December - Date and Location TBD

The address for the church is located at the bottom of the page

Game Days run from 10am till 11pm, and are open to everyone. There is a small fee per person ($5) to attend Games Day, to cover the cost of the rental hall. This fee is waived for all first-time attendees. The fee will be collected when you arrive, and will grant access to all the games contributed by our members, for use that day. We will be holding off taking any new yearly payments, but those that did pay will be honored.

Speaking of games, there are always a multitude of board, card, role-playing, and miniature games being played on any given Game Day, but a few events are near constants.

• Our Multi-Player Magic League runs each Game Day, starting around 11am. It’s a league that runs Jan-Oct. There is a second league starting at 4:30PM with modified rules and decks, please read the forum post for more information.

• Several RPG campaigns are also run each Game Day, including our "One-Shot Saturdays", stand-alone adventures run by various GMs each month.

• There are several miniature games that regularly appear at each Game Day. These vary each month, but some examples are X-Wing, Bolt Action, Lord of the Rings, Firestorm Armada, Dystopian Wars, Axis and Allies: War at Sea & Angels 20, BattleTech, AT-43, Infinity, and others.

• Don’t forget our extensive board game contingent. You can always find players for a board game, whether you bring your own or try out one of the many titles our BGers own and bring each month to our Games Library.

We ask that everyone attending our Game Days brings something along as a snack and/or drink, for the community to share in. The facility has a full kitchen, so items that need refrigerated are OK. Most people bring some soda, chips, cookies, veggie tray, etc. This helps everyone have a good time without worrying about snacks or drinks.

See you at Games Day!


Location Information:: 
Springdale United Presbyterian Church 
859 Pittsburgh Street 
Springdale, PA 15144

results.description:
Why the last minute? I just got my order and tapped my first trees this afternoon and now I have more than a gallon of maple water (aka the sap) in the fridge.! I just found out that maple water is kind of like the new coconut water. It tastes like water with just a bit of sugar in it, but … can’t get any more natural. It’s super easy and inexpensive to do – so why not?
First we’ll do a quick winter tree identification, focusing on the maples, especially the difference between sugar maple (2% sugar content) and all the other maples (1%). I have plenty of extra taps( spiles) and tubing, so people can identify and tap the trees themselves.
It will take 1 ½ - 2 hours.
If anyone is interested I can sell you a spile and 6ft of tubing for $3 and you can go out later and get your own supply of Maple water!
I will ask people to carpool from McBride to “the spot” because I don’t want to draw too much attention to what we’re doing. FYI, it will be somewhat muddy.
results.name: Tap some maple trees!

results.description:
I know most of you have visited the Aviary in the past but if it's been a while, it's always enjoyable! The photo opportunities are great and, for me, it's great practice with my camera settings. For some of you new members, come and experience the Aviary.

 The National Aviary is America’s only independent indoor nonprofit zoo dedicated exclusively to birds. Located in West Park on Pittsburgh’s historic North Side, the National Aviary’s diverse collection comprises more than 500 birds representing more than 150 species from around the world, many of them threatened or endangered in the wild. 

The National Aviary’s large walk-through exhibits create an experience unlike any other – an intimate, up-close interaction between visitors and free-flying birds, including opportunities to hand-feed and meet many species rarely found in zoos anywhere else in the world.
As an environmental organization composed of educators, conservationists and researchers, the National Aviary’s goals are many. The Aviary aims to provide outstanding education programming for varied audiences; present the highest quality family recreational experience that a zoological institution can offer; save endangered species by preserving natural habitats; continue endangered bird breeding programs and conduct meaningful avian research; engender a sincere appreciation of nature and a respect for natural law; and instill a conservation ethic that teaches our immense responsibility as stewards of the planet.

They do have a NEW show at 11:30 for an additional $5 fee to be paid at the time of your ticket purchase. 1 adult $14. 1 adult + show $19. Parking is $5

We will meet at 10:45 inside at the cafeteria area, after you've purchased your tickets.

results.description:
We are having another Saturday gaming event at the Giant Market District Express with a fella that finally thawed out long enough to have some fun, Redbeard! So bring a game you want to try, or come try some games that you likely won't find in the toy aisle at Wal-Mart. These games come from all over the world. We have a group of folks who are usually excited to teach someone a new or classic game, and we have people who are very game (sorry) to give any games that you may bring a shot. Experienced? Inexperienced? In between? Need a little coaching to get through your turn? Ready to give it a shot? Come out and see us! Drop in any time after Noon. People come and go all day. RSVPs are appreciated, but drop in last minute if that's how life is working out for you. There is no admission to attend. There is a rather good selection on food as well. For those who would enjoy beers and especially craft beers, they do have such things on site. We'll be playing in the dining area. Note that the dining area and food preparation services both shut down at 10 PM. We try to wind things down at 9:30 to make life easier on the Giant Eagle Market District Express Staff.

If you have ideas for venues and towns in which to hold an event in mind, please do contact me. We know there are a lot of towns that hope to game that we are missing good events on the map. We have a lot of assistant organizers, and we're pretty liberal about handing out the duty and title, because all it truly means is you have taken the effort to arrange something, and you should be the contact for any questions about it. We don't need money or a great amount of time from you. Just a willing heart, a face welcoming to all comers, and your enthusiasm is all it really takes. We have games. Let's go make some gamers!

Text me with your questions here on meetup, in a Personal message, or on my cell (724)[masked] .
results.name: Saturday Gaming!  Giant Eagle Market District Express

results.description:
Our first class of 2016! This class runs 1pm to 5pm on Saturday, February 20th and Sunday, February 21st.

Want to learn how to build your own website? Already have your own Tumblr/Wordpress/etc. site, but want to have more control over it? Interested in learning to program but want to start small? Our HTML & CSS for Beginners class is for you!

We'll explore how to use HTML and CSS to build websites, introduce you to the tools you need for the job and put you on the path of using your new skills to work on more complex applications.

This class will be taught by Kate Holloway.

This is a two-day class on the following days. You should only attend if you can make both days.

• Saturday, February 20th 1pm-5pm

• Sunday, February 21st 1pm-5pm

Students are required to bring their own laptop for classes. If you do not have a laptop, please contact us at [masked] before registering, and we’ll see if we can work something out. 

If you are interested in attending, but cannot afford the full class cost, please fill out our scholarship form.

Please install the following prior to the class:

One of the following browsers:

• Chrome - Recommended

• Firefox with the FireBug Extension

A text editor for working with HTML/CSS. Below are some suggestions:

• Sublime Text (freeish; OSX, Windows, Linux) - Recommended

• Notepad++ (free; Windows)


About the instructor: 

After realizing it was going to be really difficult to find a career with a Bachelor's Degree in History outside of academia, Kate went to graduate school for communications and information science. While getting two master's degrees at Syracuse University, she learned HTML/CSS, as well as the basics of graphic design, information architecture, and user research, putting it all together to become a User Experience Designer. She now works for a company that makes a web application that helps kids learn math and prepare for state tests. In her spare time, she hangs out with her cats and husband, watches a lot of Netflix, reads about education strategies and breathes through a lot of yoga.
results.name: Intro to HTML/CSS

Millions of years ago, the skies were ruled by pterosaurs, the first animals with backbones to fly under their own power. (T)ERROR

Saturday, February 20th
2 PM (Doors Open at 1 PM)
Carnegie Library of Pittsburgh – Homewood
7101 Hamilton Ave. PGH, 15208

Co-Presented by

Sembène - The Film & Arts Festival &
Masjid Al-Mu´min

Q&A with Directors Lyric R. Cabral and David Felix Sutcliffe
Admission: $6.00 ALL SEATS!! THROUGH EVENTBRITE

http://www.sembenefilmfestival.org/movie-terror/

Seating is Limited! First Come! First Served!

(T)ERROR

A FILM BY: LYRIC R. CABRAL & DAVID FELIX SUTCLIFFE Year: 2015 Country: USA Length: 84 minutes Genre: Feature Length Documentary Official Website: http://terrordocumentary.org/
Official Trailer:

https://vimeo.com/135316423

2015 Sundance Film Festival - Special Jury Award for Breakout First Feature

SYNOPSIS (Courtesy of the (T)ERROR Team)

Saeed "Shariff" Torres, a counterterrorism informant for more than two decades, takes on what he swears is his last job for the FBI and invites filmmakers to follow his covert efforts to befriend a suspected jihadist - without informing his superiors. As surprising revelations emerge, not only about Torres’ past, but also about the increasingly murky ethical grounds of his present mission, (T)ERROR explores just how far we are going to prevent terror and exactly what liberties we are sacrificing to get there.

Meet Filmmakers Lyric R. Cabral and David Felix Sutcliffe afterwards for Q&A

(T)ERROR is a co-presentation of Masjid Al-Mu´min and Sembène - The Film & Arts Festival. To learn more about Masjid Al-Mu´min, GO HERE: http://www.masjidalmumin.org/
results.name: (T)ERROR Opens International African Film Festival's 2016 Season

Click Here


Join L.L.Bean Pittsburgh as we take a hike or snowshoe across the trails of North Park. This park is beautiful in the winter and offers a variety of areas to explore. Please make sure you wear appropriate hiking clothing, waterproof footwear (if possible) and dress for the weather (layers; no cotton). Please bring snowshoeing equipment and a small day pack with extra clothes, snacks, water and any personal medications you may need. Plus a camera or binoculars if you have them. Ages 8 and up are welcome. We'll meet at Pie Traynor Field. Hope to see you on the trail!


Thank you for your interest in our free "Snowshoe or Hike Outing." L.L.Bean has a centralized reservation system. To guarantee your space, you must first confirm your reservation on our new centralized reservation system, and if appropriate, fill out a participant agreement. Please visit www.llbean.com/pittsburgh, find this event on the "Event Calendar", and register. We look forward to seeing you!

Activity Level:
Physical Ability/Cardiovascular Demand: Easy
Level of Experience: Intro

Hike distance will be about 4 miles

What to bring:
Snowshoe equipment
Dress in Layers (avoid Cotton)
Sturdy Hiking Boots
Two Light Sources: Headlamp, Flashlight, Extra Flashlight, etc.
Water to stay hydrated 
Snacks 
Completed and signed L.L.Bean participant agreement Click Here


Additional: Lip Balm, Camera, Change of Shoes, Dry Bag, Walking Stick or Trekking Poles, Personal Medicines, Eye Protection

Minimum Age 8: This outing is open to ages 8 and above. Children 8 to 14 years of age need to be accompanied by a participating adult. Children 15 to 17 years old can participate alone after their parent has signed the L.L.Bean participant agreement for minors. 

Need help preparing for your next adventure? Visit L.L.Bean Store at Ross Park Mall and ask to speak with an Outdoor Product Specialist. L.L.Bean will fit you with the right clothing and gear for all of life's adventures.

L.L.Bean Store at Ross Park Mall 
1000 Ross Park Mall Drive (Map) 
Pittsburgh, PA  15237 
L.L.Bean Outdoor Discovery Schools 
Website | Meetup | Twitter | Facebook

results.description:
brand new "supergroup" lineup for this group!!

The Consortium presents an evening of progressive jazz with Chicago's ETHNIC HERITAGE ENSEMBLE
(Kahil El'Zabar, Hamiett Bluiett, Craig Harris)
https://www.facebook.com/EthnicHeritageEnsemble/
http://www.kahilelzabar.net/
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hamiet_Bluiett
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Craig_Harris

Sat Feb 20 7:30 pm doors all ages welcome
First Unitarian Church, Morewood & Ellsworth, Shadyside

$16 advance/$20 door tickets on sale at Acoustic Music Works (Squirrel Hill), Sound Cat Records (Bloomfield), Caliban Books (Oakland), and Dave's Music Mine (South Side). After 43 years of eventful music, the Ethnic Heritage Ensemble remains the second-longest continuous group stemming from Chicago's innovative AACM collective (next to the Art Ensemble of Chicago). This year, the EHE reinvents itself again, as founder Kahil El'Zabar (percussion/vocal/composition) is joined by two true legends of the American progressive jazz scene: Hamiet bluiett (baritone sax/clarinet - World Saxophone Quartet) and Craig Harris (trombone/didjeridu - played with Sun Ra, Cecil Taylor, Sam Rivers, Don Byron, etc.)

The history and depth between these master players represents the highest level of performance, and the music is endowed with an authentic pedigree that pushes the boundaries of creative music into the soulful heart of fresh expression. The convergence of these three historical and impactful figures at this particular juncture means the Ethnic Heritage Ensemble is still reinventing itself while blazing pathways through the African American musical pantheon. Hamiett Bluiett, Craig Harris and Kahil El’Zabar are the real deal and always ready to make real music!
results.name: Ethnic Heritage Ensemble 2/20 @ First Unitarian

results.description:
Warm up your whole being with & open your heart with kirtan - yogic music, chanting & singing. The joyful and meditative practice of Kirtan has been popular in India for 5000 years. Using Sanskrit mantras, kirtan helps quiet the mind and increase our energy flow. This beautiful chanting & singing comes from the Bhakti Yoga tradition, the yoga of devotion and love. The energy of the chanting can uplift our spirit, open our hearts, and connect us deeply to the center of our being. No musical experience is necessary to join in the singing. All are welcome.

Patti "Sangita" Spadaro is a professional guitarist/singer/songwriter & a yoga/meditation teacher. She's released several CDs and has performed nationally. Long time yogis/kirtan musicians Ven and Veena Kelly have been leading kirtan for 15 years. Together, this group of musical yogis radiates wonderful good vibes! Light snacks and social time afterward. Bring a snack to share if you'd like.
$10 suggested donation - cash or check at studio, or purchase online in our store. http://www.sriyantrayoga.com
results.name: Kirtan - Yoga Music, Singing and Chanting

Now you now we are going to blow the roof off the joint !!! "Right Turn Clyde" .. is a very cool mix of Contemporary hits. Modern and classic rock with a little Country for a hell of a good time ! Located at 424 S. Main St., the Tavern and Trattoria takes up the ground floor of the three-story, red brick West End landmark, the Hershberger Block building. It actually comprises three storefronts with the Bar on the left and dining room taking up the middle and some spillage into the right. The open air feel of easy breezy dining is accentuated by large garage doors separating the three areas in one of the most unique dining areas in all of Pittsburgh. Come on Right TurnClyde Nation, lets make this a night to remember !!! Great food, Great place and great music .. US !!!!

OPENED TO 10 PEOPLE!! SEE YOU SUNDAY!

Please sign up if you're planning on playing and bring your favorite games!  Newbies are very welcome.  We have some great teachers to help you get started on your gaming adventure.  Let us know when you sign up what game(s) you'll be bringing.  On Sundays there is plenty of free parking on the side streets and even right on Murray.  Crazy Mocha serves great coffee, specialty drinks, snacks and pastries.  They do allow us to bring food in if we take our trash with us. We usually play all day, break for dinner around 6:00, then it's back to gaming until everybody poops out. 

Incidentally, many of our regular players no longer bother to sign up (but I really wish they would!), so if it looks like only  one or two people are coming, there could actually be quite a few more.  Remember, I will always cancel a game Meetup if we aren't gaming that day, so you won't be sitting there all by yourself waiting for a friend.    And please, remember to change your rsvp to no if you can't make it that day!

$1.00 will be charged to help cover the fee Meetup charges and to buy games for the group.  Join us and let the games begin!!!

results.description:
This will be a tentative 3rd part of a 3 part hike.

The "C" Loop will be 1.5 ~ 2 miles.  It is intended as a cooldown for those who have already hiked the "A" and/or "B" Loop(s)   OR   for those who are tentative about their endurance and just want to get started without getting roped into a super hilly or a longer hike than they are ready for.

I am not sure if Pleasant Valley Park is big enough to have  "C" Loop, but I will be exploring it in the next 2 weeks.  E-mail if you want come on a preliminary test run throughout the week.  

Although there may be slight overlaps with the "A" Loop, it ultimately will be different path than the "A" Loop just to keep it interesting for those who are doing both. 

              With some feedback from the Duff Park Hike, I am working on a rating system that will better help participants evaluate the difficulty of the hike from the computer screen.  So stay tuned, hike details to be updated.

Coming from Rte #22, look for the McDonald's next to Burgatory.  Inside of turning right @ McD's, turn left and go up that road.  The entrance to the park is on your left hand side.

If time or stamina is an obstacle, you are welcome to come for just this loop if you like.  I'm all about options.

I know Pleasant Valley somewhat well and I will be out hiking it several times in the next 2 weeks to map out more specific routes.  This is a park that many have not seen before so come and enjoy some new views. 

If the weather turns to heavy snow, then I will postpone this hike and do a cross-country skiing event instead.  Stay tuned for that info . . .

Dogs are always welcome on my activities.  Here is a link to the Dog Rules, pretty flex if you ask me.

results.description:
This event is part of the Introduction to Shamanic Practice program for 2016 sponsored by Embody Healing, LLC and presented by Rebekah Gamble, HP. Event Details:
Ok, folks, I've gotten a lot of requests for exceptions for the Intro to Shamanic Practice class, people who wanted to come but didn't know about the class in January and then couldn't get to the class in February due to the snow/ice/cold. Though some people simply didn't want the information in the Feb. class enough and that's the real reason they didn't come, many who are asking couldn't make it because they are disabled, bus reliant or had like instances that kept them from coming. I know what it's like to be there, and since I don't know that I'll ever offer this program again I feel down about people not being able to come due to these limiting issues.

SOOO I am setting up an online catch-up class. I apologize that it's not on a Saturday, but my next open Saturday is in April, and you really do need these two classes to have the foundation you need to do the rest of the program. Though you won't be able to have the experiences we had in the classes which help build that foundation, I am going to combine the intellectual information from the first two classes and give you a combined assignment to try to give you the same foundations. This should give you what you need to do the rest of the course, though it's not anywhere near as fun or upbuilding as the in person classes (where we did a committment ceremony and a hands-on exploration of different tools and instruments) when done over a distance, this is what I can do without scheduling other class, which is just not possible. Instead, I figured out how to do a Google hangout and we're going to do that instead.

I decided to take the time for this class from my business hours so I could spend at least one evening this week with my family, which means that I am losing client hours to provide the catch-up class. Those client hours are how I make the money that keeps my practice open. So this event is going to cost a little more than the monthly class to make up for what it's costing the business.

The cost of the catch-up online conference is $22 a person. You can send me an RSVP email and I can send you an invoice via paypal, or you can send me a PayPal payment at [masked] (I will get your email from the reciept paypal gives me, so that will be the email I use for contact for the call in link). Fifteen minutes before I start the hangout, I will email you a connection link so you can connect in. At the end of the event, I will email you all copies of the Student Guide so you have a copy as most of you do not at this time. You will want to take notes, as we're going to go through a LOT of info in that time space.

This event is for people who missed the first two classes, or who missed one of them and want the info, or for people who want to brush up on the info in the first two classes or want to get clarificaiton on something in those classes.

Anyway, hopefully this will catch a few of you up and reach the people who were not able to make it. Love to you!
results.name: Intro to Shamanic Practice Online Catch-up Conference

Join us in an evening of learning, sharing and inspiring with Holistic Modalities associated with the Root Chakra and Reiki plus much more. If you are new to Reiki; you will truly enjoy this evening. You do not need to be a Reiki Practitioner to participate.

If you are a Reiki Level 1 or 2 practitioner; you are welcome to participate in the Certificate Program towards an Advance completion as part of a 7 Workshop Program by practicing on others. At the end of all 7 workshops you attend, you will receive a Certificate and a Reiki Attunement. Completion of all of the 7 workshops; entitles you to a $25.00 discount off of Reiki Level 1, Reiki Level 2 or Reiki Master Level. These workshops are ways to learn more and practice Reiki.

TONIGHT: We cover the 1st Chakra also called the Root chakra.  It is our connection with Earth. Our foundation for our physical life and brings up safety and security.

Come at 6:00 To register, pay and ask any questions about Reiki – Workshop will begin at 6:30

We will review the Root Chakra, issues and concerns on all holistic (body, mind and spiritual) dimensions as well as how Reiki can help. Open Discussion.


We will apply Youngliving Essential oils for helping to maintain grounding and assist us with physical, emotional, mental and spiritual concerns.

We will discuss Gemstone Therapy and Color that can enhance and balance this Chakra.

I will demonstrate some Qigong Energy Movements that you can include in your holistic lifestyle practice for balancing this Chakra and bring balance to the physical areas.

And newly added Food Therapy for grounding.

We will participate in a short meditation that is specifically for grounding this area as well as enhancing your energy for healing.

Reiki Practice: If you are new to Reiki; you will get a chance to receive this wonderful, non-invasive time for Deep Relaxation and Balancing Reiki Energy Healing with 1 or more Reiki Practitioners. If you are a Reiki Level 1, 2 or Master; you are welcome to give and receive. To receive credit towards the completion for this workshop; you maybe asked to provide Reiki as practice time. Water, hot tea and a snack is provided.

Cost is $45.00 to help pay for room, materials and meetup payable by Cash, Check or CreditCard only.

I need 2 participants plus myself to run the class. Please RSVP "Yes" and keep me up to date. I Love and really enjoy these events and workshops; but if there are no participants or I'm not sure of the attendees --- then I'd like to plan time with family and friends. results.description:
The Valentine's edition of N4B's BYOB always tries to afford a little extra attention to those other spheres of love and affection we find in our lives beyond the harlequin romances and the candy and flowers of the lovelorn masses.


With the tragic loss of an internationally beloved artist and icon, I thought it would be only just to pay our respects by dedicating this edition to The Thin White Duke.

David Bowie, like ourselves, was an avid reader. The David Bowie 100 Favorite Books list was published on his Facebook page and subsequently in the LA Times and elsewhere on social media. A complete list can be found following this announcement.

The challenge is this: choose one or more of these selections to honor The Man Who Fell To Earth. If Bowie isn't your cup of tea, we still want your company, so choose your own hero and come, drink and be merry.

We can be heroes!

Sean, Commander in leaf 

N4B's BYOB is a one of a kind book club spin. It's a Bring Your Own Book happening, where we choose a monthly theme and you choose your own book. Ideally, it's grounded in the theme given - however, it can be fiction, non-fiction, biography/memoir, what-have-you. It's your chance to show and tell something off your recent reading list and share with a group of kindred readers. 

#BowieBookClub

results.description:
[from amazon]....vivid, tightly focused observations of the life of Dublin's poorer classes, their unconventional themes, coarse language, and mention of actual people and places made publishers of the day reluctant to undertake sponsorship.


Today, however, the stories are admired for their intense and masterly dissection of "dear dirty Dublin," and for the economy and grace with which Joyce invested this youthful fiction. From "The Sisters," the first story, illuminating a young boy's initial encounter with death, through the final piece, "The Dead," considered a masterpiece of the form, these tales represent, as Joyce himself explained, a chapter in the moral history of Ireland that would give the Irish "one good look at themselves." But in the end the stories are not just about the Irish; they represent moments of revelation common to all people.
results.name: Dubliners by James Joyce

----

Publicity can provide any business with a massive advantage.. but how can you get it for free as a startup? Join this webinar to learn how to generate buzz for your company, how to work with reporters, and the latest strategies for getting publicity, from two serial entrepreneurs who have both been featured on some of the world's largest publications (for free). 

This webinar will be hosted by Adeo Ressi (Founder & CEO of the Founder Institute), and feature special guest Philip Kaplan. 

Philip has been a serial entrepreneur since the 90s, creating massive press for himself while starting companies like Adbrite (one of the world’s pioneering online ad networks), Tiny Letter (a free newsletter service acquired by MailChimp), and F**ked Company (a massively popular parody site that chronicled the dot.com crash in the early 2000s). Currently, he is the Founder & CEO of DistroKid (a service that musicians use to get their music into iTunes, Spotify, and other digital music stores). 

On this webinar you will learn: 

- How to generate buzz for yourself, or your business/ startup 

- How to work effectively with reporters 

- The latest strategies for getting free publicity 

We hope you will join us!

---

results.description:
Join us for our February SQL Server User Group meeting. Paul Randal will be presenting on: Index Fragmentation: Internals, Analysis, and Solutions

As soon as you have more than one index on a table, you're going to start seeing fragmentation. Many people know that this fragmentation is bad, but why is it bad? And what is the best way to get rid of it? Come find out from the person who wrote the tools for detecting and removing index fragmentation. In this session, you’ll learn how fragmentation occurs and why the process that leads to it can often be as damaging to performance as the fragmentation itself. You'll also learn how to test for fragmentation, the different methods of removing it, and everything you need to consider when putting together an appropriate fragmentation-management strategy.


About Paul:
Paul is a Microsoft SQL Server MVP and a Microsoft Regional Director. He spent 9 years working on the SQL Server team, writing DBCC CHECKDB, and ultimately responsible for the entire Storage Engine. In 2007 Paul left Microsoft to co-own and run SQLskills.com, and is a world-renowned author, consultant, and top-rated speaker on SQL Server performance tuning, administration, internals, and HA/DR. When he's not tweeting, blogging, or helping someone recover from a disaster, he's likely to be underwater somewhere in the world with his wife, Kimberly L. Tripp.
results.name: Index Fragmentation: Internals, Analysis, and Solutions

results.description:
Join us on Tuesdays for American Mah Jong! Folks begin arriving around 5PM, and play begins table by table as soon as we have three or four players plus a set.  (We usually have 3-5 tables.)  By 6:15 or so, most players have arrived. We rotate among the tables... at the end of each game, East walks around to see if another table is close to the end of their game, so that two players can swap places.   At the other end of the evening... play must end by 9PM when Panera closes.  Tables begin wrapping up play any time after 8:15 or so.


If you have never played, or if you have not played for a very long time, we highly recommend that you take a Mah Jong 101 beginner class before playing with us - beginner classes are offered every few months.  Mah jong is a wonderful game, but it's hard to learn by just watching others play!


Please order your 2015 card from the National Mah Jongg League, here: http://www.nationalmahjonggleague.org/ Amazon.com also carries the cards. Note that you want the NMJL card, and no other! (There are some colorful alternatives out there.. but we play NMJL card and rules.)

Experienced players -- please bring your cards and please bring a set if you have one.

Please do not bring any outside food or beverages into Panera! Instead, please plan to buy *something* from Panera, even if it's just a beverage or a cookie, to support their willingness to host us.
results.how_to_find_us: Hard to miss us, look for the Mah Jong sets!
results.name: Mah Jong in Shadyside! (Note:  No beginner class tonight!)

results.description:
Come hear from Shelly Danko+Day from the City of Pittsburgh present about the Urban Agriculture Zoning Code and the Adopt-A-Lot program, and learn about preparing for gardening in Spring 2016. Shelly will review the rules for growing food, selling food, and using vacant lots for garden projects! All residents, nonprofits, community groups, and community members across all 11 Hilltop neighborhoods are encouraged to attend (Mt. Washington, Beltzhoover, Allentown, Arlington, Arlington Heights, Carrick, Mt. Oliver City, Mt. Oliver Borough, St. Clair, Bon Air, South Side Slopes & Knoxville)!!

FREE SEEDS will be handed out at registration, along with information about Seed Starting and Spring Planting Guides!

Adopt-A-Lot Program:
The Department of City Planning (DCP) has developed an Adopt-A-Lot Program, which allows residents - and groups to build temporary edible, flower, and rain garden projects on vacant City-owned lots. The program, passed November 2015 by City Council, grants licenses and leases for use of City-owned property as well as the sale of what is grown onsite, through a “market-stand lease.” Urban Agriculture Zoning Code:
Passed by the Pittsburgh City Council on July 7th, the updated Urban Agriculture Zoning code streamlines the process for keeping animals and expands the opportunity for the sale of vegetables within the City of Pittsburgh. Now, a landowner can be granted a $70 over-the-counter permit via the Zoning Division of City Planning to keep bees, chicken and goats. Individuals who grow food on land they own (backyard or a parcel used for vegetable production) may now sell produce through an on-site farmstand. Additionally, the amount of land required for a full-scale farm has been reduced to two acres.
results.name: Urban Agriculture Workshop- Free Seeds!

results.description:
Host: Innovu  

Presenter: Tony Lukasavage 
twitter: https://twitter.com/tonylukasavage
github: https://github.com/tonylukasavage

As Javascript developers we are constantly bombarded with a multitude of methods and patterns for asynchronous programming. And as is characteristic of the Javascript community, the standards (ES6 & ES7) and tools around async programming are constantly evolving.


I'm planning to lay out and dissect the modern state of JS async programming, all the way from simple callbacks up to and including the yet-to-be-finalized ES7 spec for the holy grail: the async/await API.

I'll be covering the following async methodologies/tools:

• callback hell
• async.js
• Promises
• co + generators + Promises
• async/await

with some slides/context, but mostly a lot of live coding, practical examples, and hacking based on feedback from the group in attendance. I'm also more than happy to stay after to discuss the practical application of one or more of these patterns to your own code bases.

Pizza and beer/soda will be available.
results.name: Asynchronous Programming: State of the Union

results.description:
In recent years, machine learning has  fueled advances in logistics, retail, media consumption, health care, finance and banking.  These solutions have earned relatively few people a lot of money!

Can machine learning also be applied to social problems for the betterment of all? 

Amy Hepner, Data Scientist at Rhiza, will discuss four real world problems tackled this past summer by Data Science for Social Good fellows (dssg.io):

1.)  Identifying police officers at an increased risk of adverse public interaction

2.) Early detection of high school students not on track to graduate

3.) Locating blighted homes in Cincinnati, and

4.) Targeting supporters for online political activism and fundraising

Focusing on the opportunities and risks of applying math to human service, we will discuss the basics of “supervised machine learning” and the implications of applying math to community: when is it helpful and how can we assure that it is not perpetuating systemic bias? 

This talk requires little to no experience in math, computer science or statistics. Come if you’ve always wondered what machine learning/analytics really means, or if you are interested in math solutions to social justice problems.
results.how_to_find_us: Please enter through the door adjacent to Social Bakery Square. Look for C&S signs.
results.name: The Analytics of Social Progress: When Machine Learning meets Human Problems
