results.description:
Join us for a 2-hour session of indoor volleyball open gym! You'll get a ton of playing time in a well-organized event. Our host will check players in, divide players into teams, and make sure that everything runs smoothly. All you have to do is show up ready to play!

Pricing:

• $7 - RSVP online and pay in advance (online rsvp closes at 4:30 pm!)

• $9 - RSVP and pay cash at the event

• $10 - Show up and play - be sure to check online to make sure there is room!

What to Wear: We are playing indoors on a rubberized all-sport surface. Most players wear volleyball-specific shoes, but gym shoes are also allowed. Please bring your shoes and change into them at the facility. This will help keep the floor clean of dirt and water.

What to Expect: Show up early! The games will begin at the time posted for this event. Players can start checking in with the event host as early as 15 minutes before the scheduled start time. If a court is available, you may begin warming up before the event begins. We limit play to 42 players per evening, which is 3 teams of 7 players per court. If we have 3 teams on a court, winners stay once and then shuffle out so everyone gets to play. If less people are in attendance, we divide based on who is there and mix things up half way through the session.

Level of Play: This event is open to all levels of play. We do our best to create even teams so that games are well-matched. Our ideal scenario is having one court of higher skilled players and one court of more recreational players. There are no referees, so players need to play with sportsmanship and make their own calls. We aim to make everyone feel welcome at these events.

Facility Information: Monroeville Sports Center is located at 855 Macbeth Drive in Monroeville. Parking should be ample in the free lot.

Minimum number of players and playing formats. This event needs a minimum of 12 people (not including the host) signed up before the start of the event in order to run. An email notification will be sent if we cancel. Refunds or credits will be issued if we cancel the event. Sign up early to encourage more people to sign up!!

Do Your Part! Help us keep an accurate guest count! If you RSVP, we're counting on you to be there. If you change your mind about playing or your guest count changes, please update your RSVP. No-Shows will be marked on your account. If space is tight, we hold RSVP spots 10 minutes into advertised start and then open spots to walk-ups.

Requirements to play: This is an adult volleyball group. You must be 19 older. Males and females of all skill levels are welcome to play. There is no required gender ratio. Players are expected to conduct themselves with good sportsmanship.

What's included in the price? Your payment helps to cover the rental costs, the hourly pay for your event host, and ensures a well-organized event.

Questions? Post your question in the comments section of this meetup and the event host or one of our organizers will reply. You can also message the organizers directly through meetup. Or, give us a call M-F 8:00am-12:30pm:[masked]-7130.

results.description:
Some notes before we get to the book selection - 

1.  We are meeting on a date that we wouldn't normally meet since I scheduled a movie with this group on our normal date.  I'm sorry if any of our regulars can't make it, but we'll go back to the 3rd Wednesday in March.

2.  These are the months when we never know what the weather will be like.  Please look at the comments and your email before coming out.  If I decide the weather is too bad to venture out I will post and email the "yes" RSVPs.

3.  We chose books for February and March.  If you like to read ahead, the book for MARCH is The Widow Waltz by Sally Koslow.

And now the book for FEBRUARY... The Art of Arranging Flowers by Lynne Branard.

A moving and eloquent novel about love, grief, renewal—and the powerful language of flowers.
  Ruby Jewell knows flowers. In her twenty years as a florist she has stood behind the counter at the Flower Shoppe with her faithful dog, Clementine, resting at her feet. A customer can walk in, and with just a glance or a few words, Ruby can throw together the perfect arrangement for any occasion.
  Whether intended to rekindle a romance, mark a celebration, offer sympathy, or heal a broken heart, her expressive floral designs mark the moments and milestones in the lives of her neighbors. It’s as though she knows just what they want to say, just what they need.
  Yet Ruby’s own heart’s desires have gone ignored since the death of her beloved sister. It will take an invitation from a man who’s flown to the moon, the arrival of a unique little boy, and concern from a charming veterinarian to reawaken her wounded spirit. Any life can be derailed, but the healing power of community can put it right again.

results.description:
Topic: Secure Code? What are your libraries hiding, and how do you know?


Abstract: Libraries and Frameworks greatly assist developers to bolster functionality and meet deadlines. However, are these components introducing risk and vulnerabilities? Also, how does an overtasked and deadline driven developer stay up-to-date on the state of these dependencies? Attendees will discover the alarming statistics that security professionals identified regarding the sheer percentages of vulnerable libraries and frameworks. Additionally, participants will acquire information on some great manual scripts and open-source utilities to help automate this process. Since writing all components from scratch is too cumbersome and inefficient, attend this session to acquire the means to ensure the best risk adverse and well maintained libraries are utilized.


Speaker: Kevin Cody

Bio: Kevin Cody is an Application Security Engineer with experience working at several Fortune 500 enterprises. Although his particular expertise is geared toward hacking Web and Mobile applications, he is also very interested in the entire gamut from mainframes to embedded systems. He currently is on the leadership team of OWASP Pittsburgh, and actively encourages engagement of any and all developers that enjoy learning about security.
results.name: OWASP Pittsburgh Chapter Q1 2016 MeetUp

results.description:
Update:  I just posted the following file

Ch 3:  Grammaire à l'oeuvre - L'interrogation. you may download it and print it out for tomorrow.

 - We will cover all sorts of Questions - I'm in the process of 'distilling' la grammaire à l'oeuvre
 - I will continue with vocabulary building - un voyage virtuel en France.
 - Article on some aspect of French culture

This is a discussion group EN FRANCAIS for those (intermediate and higher) wishing to perfect their conversational French.

I will bring materials for learning/teaching.  This will include 1 song, but there will also be a chapter from:

• La grammaire à l'oeuvre (John Barson-Stanford) - many consider to be the best grammar/conversation book ever written (I have French friends who use it for review).  John Barson was interested in using science fiction, art and other unusual 'gaming' techniques in perfecting grammar and expression.


• Le français Départ/Arrivée (Rassias - Dartmouth) - another classic text.  Rassias was by nature a theater person, and originator of a unique language learning method - very much "in your face" and physical-response oriented.


I will also focus on practicing authentic French phrases and pronunciation.

I say this, because many Americans have reached a plateau in their language learning - and this is totally normal.  BUT in order to progress to the next level, some heavy lifting is in order. 

Homework (reading, writing, listening) will be assigned, also.
results.how_to_find_us: Nous serons à l'intérieur
results.name: Int-Adv French Conversation @ Wexford Panera Breads:  L'INTERROGATION

Come out for the Praxis Pittsburgh February meetup at Harris Grill in Shadyside! We'll be discussing entrepreneurship, big ideas, and accelerating your career to success.

This will be the first meetup hosted by me, Nick. I graduated high school this last spring and I'm now a Praxis participant working with a local entrepreneur in Pittsburgh. I'll speak briefly about my experience as a young person taking on the entrepreneurial world. I'll cover my experience, my choice to jump directly into the real world of business in lieu of college, and how young people can accelerate their careers. 

Other than that we'll just be sharing ideas, drinks, and food! Be sure to come out Thursday and join us in Shadyside. We're excited about meeting early stage startup founders, young people hungry to get their careers started, and everybody in between! We'll have free copies of books like The Future of School, Why Haven't You Read This Book? and others available for those interested.

results.description:
An advance welcome to you – our prospective guest…

Perhaps you’ve been thinking about going to a Toastmasters meeting for awhile.

Maybe you’re not quite certain what to expect, and so you’ve hesitated.

Given that fear of public speaking has ranked as the top phobia for quite some time, you’ve got plenty of company! At the same time, the most important skill, and it is indeed a “skill” -- not something that one is born with, or is “automatically” comfortable and effective for anyone -- is communication.

How we communicate influences most every aspect of our personal and professional lives. Wherever you happen to be in your communications process, the supportive environment of our club can make a positive difference. As renowned and respected motivational speaker Les Brown has maintained throughout his impressive career, “Practice makes improvement.”

You may notice that the emphasis is NOT upon perfection, but rather, upon effort and growth, over the course of time. We hope that you will consider Club 1104 – Penn Hills Toastmasters as a place where you can feel comfortable and encouraged as you embark upon your path to improved communication.

See you at the next meeting!

http://1104.toastmastersclubs.org/
results.name: Penn Hills Toastmasters

results.description:
The Pittsburgh Change Ringing Guild meets regularly on Thursday nights to practice and hone our change ringing skills.

Non-ringers are welcome to attend Thursday night practices to come check out what we do.  When entering the tower, the most important rule is DO NOT touch the ropes unless specifically instructed to by an experienced bell ringer.  If people are currently ringing the bells when you walk in the room, please come in quietly and have a seat around the edges of the room.  We will stop ringing in a few minutes, and can give you an introduction to the bells.

Non-Ringers can also have an opportunity to try pulling the bell under the guidance of an experienced bell ringer.  We are also more than happy to teach you the ancient art of bell ringing.
Learning to ring the bells does take some time before you would be able to ring comfortably on your own.  Obviously the more effort you put into it the more quickly you would be able to ring confidently on your own.  You can expect 4-6 weeks of individual instruction to get to that stage.  And then once you learn how to handle the bells, that opens up a lifetime of ringing opportunities!

Check out the videos below to see what the bell ringing is like, and you are more than welcome to come join us for our practice night!  Please RSVP if you are coming, because practices sometimes get cancelled for various reasons.

Bells swinging: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=liuRptmR088 
Ringers pulling ropes: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M1vSfNF7OfI
results.how_to_find_us: Enter Southminster church by the doors between the church and the middle school. Either walk to the 4th floor or take the elevator to the 4th floor. Turn left and continue up the stairs to the Bell Tower.
results.name: Change Ringing Practice Night

results.description: The "Incito Veritas" founding fathers (which included females, of course, as no soul has a gender) originally called this group "Fight Club" and first intended to keep that name while maintaining secrecy. So much for that. But the spirit of Fight Club remains, the idea of trying to bring out the best in each other through the evolution of consciousness. As Brad Pitt said about the movie, "Fight Club is a metaphor for the need to push through the walls we put around ourselves and just go for it." And not fear the pain! In this meetup we discuss ways that concepts introduced during the Incito Veritas series can be applied to our daily lives. We will learn and grow as we process our experiences. Bottom line: Knowing and Not Doing is Not Knowing, or as it says in James 2:26, "For as the body without the spirit is dead, so faith without works is dead."
results.name: Fight Club: Ready ... Set ... Action!

results.description:
Hello everyone!

If you are reading this you probably at least have a passing interest in this new modern board gaming fad. 

If you are under the impression that we play games like Monopoly, Risk, Clue, and Candyland you are in for a rude awakening.

Modern board gaming is experiencing growth like crazy!  Not only with the number of people playing games but also with the number of new releases every year.  Can you believe there were over 700 new games released last year and that number is expected to rise even more this year. 

Even relatively new modern board games that you might have heard of like Settlers of Catan is now over twenty years old and another modern classic Ticket to Ride is over ten.  We still play and enjoy the older modern games but it is primarily because the companies keep them fresh by offering expansions to the regular content.  When was the last time you saw a content update to Monopoly or Risk?

Today's board games come in all different shapes, sizes, themes, components, and our group plays all kinds.. Here are some examples of the types of games we play...

Party games like:  Codenames, Spyfall, and Dixit.

Euro style games like:  Five Tribes, Orleans, Puerto Rico, Viticulture, and Lords of Waterdeep. 

Abstract games like:  Qwirkle, Blokus, and Hive

Card games like:  Dominion, Glory to Rome, Diamonds, and Munchkin

Those are just a few of the games that can be seen being played at our meetups every week.

Our members come in all shapes and sizes and span from young to older but all seem to have a great time when we get together!

Our organizers try to be very accommodating to new players and try to pick games appropriate to your skill level and that we think you would enjoy.  Our goal is to get you enthusiastic about the hobby.

If there is a game that you would like to try out just r.s.v.p. to one of our meetups and suggest it down in the chat.  Chances are that one of us has it in our collection and we can bring it out.

Look forward to introducing the hobby to many more players in 2016 and continued good times with our regulars.

Please r.s.v.p. early so I have an idea on how many people or coming and what games to bring along.  You can always cancel your r.s.v.p. if you have a change of plans.


See you soon!

Russ.

results.description:
Sembene - The Film & Arts Festival is co-presenting this film with the 2016 CMU International Film Festival.

3½ MINUTES, TEN BULLETS


Sneak Preview!!
A Co-Presentation Of
SEMBÈNE - THE FILM & ARTS FESTIVAL
&
2016 CARNEGIE MELLON INTERNATIONAL Film Festival
Friday, February 26th – 6:00 PM
McConomy Auditorium -
CMU Main Campus

(Reception to Follow)
For tickets, visit http://www.cmu.edu/faces/tickets.html

Winner, U.S. Documentary Special Jury Award for Social Impact,
2015 Sundance Film Festival


Reviews


"A grimly absorbing watch." - Peter Bradshaw, The Guardian (Full Review)

"Tragedy IS black and white." - Maggie Foucault, Complex (Full Review)

"'3 1/2 minutes' is a boulder of racial profiling, entitlement and gun violence that leaves you pensive long after the credits roll." - Shenequa Golding, Vibe (Full Review)

3½ Minutes, Ten Bullets

Runtime: 99 minutes Rating: Not Rated Language: English

Visit our website for more info

SYNOPSIS (Courtesy of Dogwoof)

In 3½ Minutes, two lives intersected and were forever altered. On Black Friday in 2012, two cars parked next to each other at a Florida gas station. A white middle-aged male and a black teenager exchanged angry words over the volume of the music in the boy’s car. A gun entered the exchange, and one of them was left dead.

Michael Dunn fired 10 bullets at a car full of unarmed teenagers and then fled. Three of those bullets hit 17-year-old Jordan Davis, who died at the scene. Arrested the next day, Dunn claimed he shot in self-defense. Thus began the long journey of un-raveling the truth. 3½ Minutes, Ten Bullets follows that journey, reconstructing the night of the murder and revealing how hidden racial prejudice can result in tragedy.

Directed by Marc Silver (Who is Dayani Cristal?), the documentary intercuts powerful exclusive footage from a riveting trial with intimate, observational scenes of Jordan’s parents, Ron and Lucy. We see firsthand how difficult it is for them to grapple with unimaginable loss while fighting for justice for their son. The film integrates police interrogation footage, prison phone recordings and interviews with the others at the scene that night. The result is a powerful story about the devastating effects of racial bias, and the search for justice within the judicial
results.name: 3-1/2 MINUTES, 10 BULLETS SNEAK PREVIEW OF CMUIFF

results.description:
Get a glimpse of CMU International Film Festival's TENTH ANNIVERSARY season with a documentary that will surely change the way you think about gun safety in America.

JOIN US!  
Director Marc Silver will introduce his film with a special greeting from Cuba! Stick around after the screening for a highly anticipated appearance by special guest Ron Davis, Jordan Davis's father, a riveting discussion about gun safety in America by a panel of local experts, and a dessert reception.

Presented in in partnership with CMU Idea Space: Innovative Solutions for Gun Violence & Gun Safety and co-sponsored by CMU’s Center for Africanamerican Urban Studies & the Economy (CAUSE), Division of Student Affairs, and Sembène Film & Arts Festival.

Find FREE parking at the Forbes Avenue Parking Lot after 5pm!

BUY TICKETS HERE


FILM DESCRIPTION  
"3 ½ Minutes, 10 Bullets is a powerful, gripping and deeply shocking film, and a contemptuous critique of Florida’s stand-your-ground law." –Simon Crook, Empire

The last moments of Jordan Davis’ life are the starting point for 3 ½ Minutes, 10 Bullets. Marc Silver’s drama, which premiered at the Sundance Film Festival 2015 explores the danger and subjectivity of Florida’s Stand Your Ground self-defense laws by weaving Dunn’s trial with a chorus of citizen and pundit opinions, and with Jordan Davis’s parents’ wrenching experiences in and out of the courtroom. The film portrays Davis’s murder and its aftermath as anything but generic. Instead, the intimate camera particularizes each character as singular, as if to say: The more we see each other as human beings, the less inevitable will be violent outcomes from racial bias and disparate cultures colliding.


TRAILER

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RKbCoRA__UI


Reception & Film Location

This event is General Admission (open seating) and takes place inside the Jared L. Cohen University Center (where the café areas are also located) next to the tennis courts.   And if you were standing on Forbes facing the main campus (near the bus shelter at Forbes & Morewood), you would see the famous 'Walking to the Sky' sculpture (where people appear to walking up a 10-story angled pole) in front of you, and the Cohen University Center would be very long building to your left. The McConomy Auditorium is on the 1st floor of the Cohen University Center. Please print out this campus map before you go http://www.cmu.edu/homeimages/campus-map/cmu_mapcolor_8x11.pdf -- the Cohen University Center is Building #13 on this map. 


Here is what the McConomy Auditorium looks like inside http://www.cmu.edu/cohon-university-center/reserve-space/event-spaces/mcconomy.html

At this breakfast, Scott Stevens, Lead Pastor of North Way Christian Community, will be sharing what he believes to be the most important leadership lesson for the next generation. You don't want to miss this!

Scott's Bio:

As the Lead Pastor, Scott is the directional leader, overseeing Campus Pastors and the Teaching Team.  He leads the Executive Leadership and Operational Ministry Teams. Before becoming the Lead Pastor, he served as Family Pastor for six years and Executive Pastor for three years. He served many years in ministry before coming to North Way in 2002. Scott is a native Pittsburgher with a love for all things “Pittsburgh.” He lives in Wexford  with his wife Tina, and they have two grown daughters, Alyssa and Erin. “Go Bucs!”

results.description:
All Day Training on the 27th - get massive rents Reply to my email below to save your spot We have a full house 172 people on Tuesday to hear Gene Gurano talk about how he is getting up to $10,000 per month out of single family rentals. Yes that is not a typo. Gene and his company are converting single family houses into assisted living facilities and riding the wave of an aging population. Allegheny county has the oldest population in America, we might want to learn about this. I can tell you that the 1 hour presentation the Gene did was fascinating. I learned a lot, but I need to learn a lot more before I can put this plan into motion. Here is what I can tell you, basically you can convert your single family rental into a mini assisted living facility without even having any employees or licenses. Let me clue you in here, locally people are paying over $8000 per month for a single room. There were REIA members in the room who verified this price point. What would that do for you cash flow?

So we have Gene's partner coming back to teach an all day session on what and how they are making insane amounts of money with assisted living rentals.

Save the date Feb 27th, next Saturday. We will be hosting an all day seminar on setting up single family assisted living. When 9 am to 5 pm or so
Where - Crowne Plaza Pittsburgh West (Greentree) 401 Holiday Dr
Pittsburgh, PA 15220

FREE Indoor Cycling Class At Your Pittsburg Performance Bicycle Store.

Your Pittsburg Performance Bicycle Store is holding a free indoor cycling class that’s designed to be fun, low-key and give you a great introduction to indoor cycling.

While the class promises a great workout that will help you kick-start your fitness plans,you don’t have to worry about flashing lights, loud music or an instructor who thinks they’re training everyone for an Ironman.

Everyone has to start somewhere, and your local Performance Bicycle Store is a great place to introduce yourself to indoor cycling. That’s why everyone is welcome.

When: Every Saturday at 9am.

Duration: Class is one hour

Instructor:  A friendly and supportive store employee

What you need to bring:  a bike, a trainer, water bottle, towel,

Optional: fan, trainer mat, nutrition, wheel riser block

Hope to see you there.  If you have any questions, please call your local Performance Bicycle Store.

Enjoy your workout!

results.description:
Don't you just love the feeling of snuggling with your favorite blanket? Wouldn't you love to give others that feeling?

All the blankets made will be donated to Project Linus and distributed LOCALLY ONLY. Project Linus, a national organization with chapters in all 50 states, collect blankets and distribute to children locally in hospitals, shelters, social service agencies, emergency servies, or anywhere a child may be in need of some comfort. Over 5,000,000 blankets have been donated since Project Linus started!

We are looking for volunteers to participate in the making of blankets, along with donations of fleece fabric (JoAnn Fabrics always has coupons!) Project Linus requests blankets to be no smaller than 36" x 42". Keep this in mind when purchasing your fabrics. All fabric donations should be brought to the library no later than February 24th, so it can be laundered and readied for "Make a Blanket Day" (laundering removes any loose dyes).

If you can't bring a donation in advance, no worries - just bring unlaundered fleece and we'll put you to work on some that has been laundered. Also, if you want to bring your own scissors to work with, that would be good too.

Donation of material or not, we really need people to help make the blankets! No craft experience or skills are necessary....we'll help you out.

When you get to the library, tell them you're there for Project Linus - ask for Sue or Cynde.


http://www.westernalleghenylibrary.org/index.php?option=com_wrapper&view=wrapper&Itemid=114
results.name: Project Linus - Make a Blanket for a Kid Day

results.description:
Welcome to the first meeting of 2016! We got a bit of a late start, but starting in March we will be on schedule. Welcome to new members! I am happy to see that this group is still growing after more than a year!

Topic for this meeting

C.S. Lewis is a famous author of children's stories, but in addition he was: a poet, academic, medievalist, literary critic, essayist, lay theologian, broadcaster, lecturer, and Christian apologist. In his own words he once said, "I am the most dejected, reluctant convert in all England". C.S. Lewis was an atheist, an intellectual, logic was his tool of trade. Then he converted to Christianity. All for very rational reasons. We will see his rationale in our upcoming meetings. 

He wrote a famous book about apologetics called "Mere Christianity" in which he uses logical arguments to deduce why Christianity must be true. This book is very often quoted by nearly all apologists I have ever heard. 

During our next few meetings we will be looking at the book "Mere Christianity" in detail. We could just read it, and discuss it, but there is an excellent illustrated version of it on youtube. 

We will watch these short videos together during the meetings and then discuss the topics from the videos. 

These videos are actually BBC radio broadcasts during WW2 of C.S. Lewis himself reading his book, and an excellent artist illustrates what C.S. Lewis is discussing to get the message across even stronger. 

Here is a link to the video 


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QmHXYhpEDfM&list=PL9boiLqIabFhrqabptq3ThGdwNanr65xU

FYI: Interesting sidenote: These BBC talks were meant to ask the question, "Is England the moral country in the conflict of WW2 or is Germany?". This was way before anything was known about the Holocaust. So Lewis goes into a philosophical discourse of what is right and what is wrong, and where God fits in. 

We will be meeting at the Squirrel Hill library in meeting room C as usual. Let me know if you have any questions!

-Geno
results.name: Pittsburgh Apologetics Club Meeting 18

Welcome everyone!

This is my first time ever doing something like this!  I'm a gay single African American father.  I have two children.  Drey was adopted at age 16 and is now 25 years old.  He still lives with me.  Luke is 20 months and is a biological child.  He lives with his mother.  I see him approximately five times a week.  Conveniently Luke lives right next door.

I am at wits end as to how to help Drey to become an independent adult and "What do you do with a baby?"  No How To Manual came with him!

I am very excited gentlemen to embark on this endeavor.  I believe that we can become support for one another.

Hope to see you there ...

Tom Preston, Host

Don't miss your opportunity to hike in an urban setting. Join us for a tour of Pittsburgh, capturing the shots only to be had on a pleasantly paced hike. The adventure starts with a ride on the T, and will include a ride in the Duquesne Incline (fare required) along the way.


Group will meet and finish at the Allegheny Station. We'll take the T to one of the downtown T terminals and urban hike enjoying many photo opportunities. My plan is to make decisions while in the city on which places we explore. We may or may not be taking the incline.


Follow this link to view a map of a route taken previously--> Click Here

Thank you for your interest in our free "Urban Photography Hike Outing." L.L.Bean has a centralized reservation system. To guarantee your space, you must first confirm your reservation on our new centralized reservation system, and if appropriate, fill out a participant agreement. Please visit www.llbean.com/pittsburgh, find this event on the "Event Calendar", and register. We look forward to seeing you!


If we have more than 10 people paying for the Duquesne Incline, we'll pay the group rate. I'll collect the fares and rates are listed below.


***Come prepared with exact change***

Standard one-way rates:
Adults (Ages 12-64) $2.50
Children (Ages 6-11) $1.25

If we have enough participants, a group rate will apply:
Group rates are valid for any group of ten or more people

Activity Level:
Physical Ability/Cardiovascular Demand: Easy
Level of Experience: Intro

Hike distance will be ~5 miles

What to bring:
Camera or other Photo Device
Dress in Layers (avoid Cotton) 
Comfortable Outdoor Footwear
Water to stay hydrated 
Snacks 
Completed and signed L.L.Bean participant agreement Click Here


Optional: Optics, Lip Balm, Change of Shoes, Dry Bag, Walking Stick or Trekking Poles, Personal Medicines

Minimum Age 8: This outing is open to ages 8 and above. Children 8 to 14 years of age need to be accompanied by a participating adult. Children 15 to 17 years old can participate alone after their parent has signed the L.L.Bean participant agreement for minors.


Need help preparing for your next adventure? Visit L.L.Bean Store at Ross Park Mall and ask to speak with an Outdoor Product Specialist. L.L.Bean will fit you with the right clothing and gear for all of life's adventures.

results.description:
Hey everyone,

20 people is an awesome attendance! I'm very excited about this! Way to go everyone!


Just a reminder that this week, we were only able to book two courts for the first hour, then one court for the next hour.  We can possibly keep the one court longer, but (last I heard) that was the best Greentree Sportsworks was able to do for us this week.


I'm glad to see all the enthusiasm, but I just don't what anyone who didn't realize about the court limitations to be disappointed.

I have thought carefully about this.  20 people trying to share two badminton courts the normal way would mean quite a bit of waiting around.  In fact if we all arrive on time and stay for the two hours, since we have three court-hours booked, and each court-hour translates to four player-hours (doubles format), we have twelve player-hours booked.  Based on the RSVP's we'll all be spending two hours at the facility (plus our drive times) for 12 player hours/20  players or 60% of an hour (36 minutes of play, average, per player), unless we stay longer.


(Correction ::  We have two courts for two hours, AND a third court for one hour)


I propose we consider playing "king's court" during the latter hour if we are reduced to one court as expected.
This is where mini-matches are played and the winner of each mini-match defends the "king's court" while everyone else takes turn being the challengers.
It is fast-paced, and funny because each player serves as soon as they can, not necessarily waiting until the other side is ready.  this brings an element of surprise and sabotage to the game -- no one is immune , even the best players, to being deposed off their "throne", and everyone stays busy and involved :)


Another good thing about this meetup is it will be cheap... the cost of the three court hours is $75 plus birdies and tape so dividing the approximately $80 twenty ways is only $4 each).  And who knows, maybe we will be able to get another court after all (there's always a chance the other party may cancel). 

Correction: More like five court hours, $125 + misc, so more like $6, at most $7 per person if everyone shows up.


Consider posting under our discussion forums about where in the city you live (approximately, as in what neighborhood or at least what direction you are coming to Greentree from and about how long it takes you to get there).

We are a big enough group we should be able to get additional regularly scheduled times and places going in the greater Pittsburgh area.

I'm trying to get the attention of the group for an opportunity to rent three badminton courts every Sunday night, usually we could start at 6 pm but there may be some weeks where we can't start until 7, but we could rent them for as long as we want which means we can have as big of a group as we want (48 players over two hours everyone would get at least half hour play time, in theory). Please read and consider RSVPing for the Southpointe Courthouse opportunity on Sunday evenings I posted.

We could also arrange to use that facility on another night of the week, but we'd have to sign up months in advance. We might be able to start by September? Who would be interested in say, Tuesday nights at that facility?


(Advantages of Southpointe Courthouse include their willingness to purchase real badminton nets (instead of the volleyball nets we use at Greentree), and that there are already semi-permanent (taped) lines put down, instead of putting down our own lines every time)
results.name: Greentree Sportsworks, Sat, Feb 27, 4-6pm

results.description:
Let us come together to build a community of meditators and spread the benefits of meditation among Pittsburghers. So come and join with us in a Joyful meditation for health and happiness and tell the whole city "I Meditate Pittsburgh." :-)

There are no prerequisites and all above 12 yrs of age are welcome to join. Consider telling your friends and bring them along.

Event will be simple. We will start with some introduction to meditation, do some gentle stretches and have a guided meditation with the group. At the end we will share our experiences and open floor for questions and discussions. You can also ask any questions you may have in the beginning or email us now.

Please RSVP for the event and we look forward to seeing you.
results.name: Meditation for Health and Happiness

results.description:
Full Schedule Posted below... Remember this is a Charity crawl read below and read Rule #1!!!


Pittsburgh Pub Crawl - International

Presents

Southside Bar Crawl!

Sat. Feb 27th, +21 Event GET TO THE FIRST 5 BARS or you can't crawl with us! You have till 9:20pm!!!

If a bar is TOO CROWDED, scout ahead to the next one, get a drink (or food). TO GET IN WITH NO COVER YOU MUST BE REGISTERED and have a Crawl Bracelet, This is a Charity Crawl which goes to the American Lung Association Fight for Air Stair Climb Challenge ($5 a person). 

6pm - 6:50pm JACKS BAR (IN THE BACK ROOM!!!)- 1117 E. Carson Street! MEET IN BACKROOM BY POOL TABLES to GET NAME TAGS AND REGISTER FOR THE CRAWL.  JACKS is the cheapest bars if you order well drinks or domestic drafts!

6:50pm - 7:30pm TWELVE on CARSON-NEW BAR! Corner of 12th & Carson.  $3Yeunglings Drafts

7:30 - 8:10 Smiling Moose - 1306 E. Carson Street GET NAME TAGS AND REGISTER FOR THE CRAWL  $3.25 Well Drinks, High Life Drafts $2

8:210 - 8:50pm Dee's Cafe - 1314 E. Carson Street GET NAME TAGS AND REGISTER FOR THE CRAWL $2 Miller lite Bottle.  Smoking Bar

GOING OFF OF CARSON

8:50pm - 9:30 Pre-Game Cafe -NEW BAR! 1514 Sarah Street GET NAME TAGS AND REGISTER FOR THE CRAWL AFTER THIS NO MORE CRAWL REGISTRATION OR NAMETAGS!  SHOW UP BEFORE 9:20pm!!!  $5 Trash Cans, $3 Bombs

TWO BARS

9:30 - 10:10pm Jekyll & Hyde - 140 South 18th Street! ASK ABOUT EVIL DRINK SPECIAL!!!

9:30 - 10:10pm Rusty Barrel Saloon - NEW BAR! 153 South 18th Street, $2 Any drink (not top shelf).  Smoking Bar

TWO BARS - ps. Remember RULE #1 (see below)

10:20pm - 11:10pm White Eagle - 2300 East Carson Street $2.50 Domestic Drafts Smoking Bar

10:20pm - 11:10pm SOUTHPAW - NEW BAR! 2210 East Carson Street.  THEY HAVE A BAND: "BOAT SHOES, BAD NEWS!" no cover for crawlers! $2 Cans, $5 Bomb drinks, SMOKED WINGS!

TWO BARS - DANCE YOUR ASS OFF! Make sure you have your ID!!!  GOTTA HAVE YOUR CRAWL BRACELET (show up on time!!!)

11:15pm to Close TIKI Lounge - 2003 E. Carson Street!  DJ & Dancing, Top 40!  $3 Cuervo Cinge, No Cover for Crawlers

11:15pm to Close LAVA Lounge - 2204 E. Carson Street  DJ & Dancing  $2.75 PBR special

Do NOT DRINK AND DRIVE! Classy Cab [masked]Yellow Cab (412)[masked] OR USE UBER\LYFT!!!

THE RULES: Number 1. RULE: No Whining!!!

2. Our Dues have tripled it now costs NO MONEY!!! to go on crawls. UNLESS It's A CHARITY CRAWL and then it's still CHEAP! This is a Charity crawl so it's $5 a person. Remember we are doing this for the hell of it!!!

Occasionally we do a CHARITY BAR CRAWL any donation is okay, including not donating you cheap bastard ;-)

3. It is good to tip; it is not so good to assume you know the best place to put the bills.

4. If you ignore the whistle and show up late to the next bar or without a nametag, you may not get the special and you may have to pay the cover to get in. You can get nametags at the first 3 bars.

5. You are responsible for your behavior. If you get drunk, it is your own fault, not our fault and not the bar's. Take a cab home.(We recommend Classy Cab or UBERX I like going home in a Limo). 

6. You are also responsible for the people you invite. If you know someone is a nasty or problem drunk, do not invite him..her. The pub-crawl is not the place for him/her to display his/her talents. If you cause a problem, you will be asked to leave and so will the person who invited you. We have a good reputation.

7. We are hitting 11 BARS YOU Don't have to DRINK at every BAR and remember to EAT!

Remember this will be a PACKED CRAWL! I'm picking the LARGER and sometimes more OFF-THE-BEATEN TRACK places so we can fit in. But like always, if a place is TOO CROWDED, Scout Ahead and get your seats. Also we will have at some time slots TWO BARS at the SAME TIME! towards the END of the Crawl.

Remember UBER\LYFT, Designated Drivers, Classy Cab, Yellow Cab and PRICELINE (for getting hotels), Air BNB, Couchsurfing Dot Com are your friends. Or staying at a friends house or hooking up with a local (Use protection ;-). Don't FRIGGING DRINK & DRIVE!

We should have 100+ people going to this crawl! Full Schedule Posted below... Remember this is a Charity crawl read below and read Rule #1!!! Cross-posted on 10 Meetups & 3 Facebook Events so LOTS more showing up than just here!

Presents

Southside Bar Crawl!

Sat. Feb 27th, +21 Event GET TO THE FIRST 5 BARS or you can't crawl with us! You have till 9:20pm!!!

If a bar is TOO CROWDED, scout ahead to the next one, get a drink (or food). TO GET IN WITH NO COVER YOU MUST BE REGISTERED and have a Crawl Bracelet, This is a Charity Crawl which goes to the American Lung Association Fight for Air Stair Climb Challenge ($5 a person).

6pm - 6:50pm JACKS BAR (IN THE BACK ROOM!!!)- 1117 E. Carson Street! MEET IN BACKROOM BY POOL TABLES to GET NAME TAGS AND REGISTER FOR THE CRAWL. JACKS is the cheapest bars if you order well drinks or domestic drafts!

8:210 - 8:50pm Dee's Cafe - 1314 E. Carson Street GET NAME TAGS AND REGISTER FOR THE CRAWL $2 Miller lite Bottle. Smoking Bar

GOING OFF OF CARSON

8:50pm - 9:30 Pre-Game Cafe -NEW BAR! 1514 Sarah Street GET NAME TAGS AND REGISTER FOR THE CRAWL AFTER THIS NO MORE CRAWL REGISTRATION OR NAMETAGS! SHOW UP BEFORE 9:20pm!!! $5 Trash Cans, $3 Bombs

TWO BARS

9:30 - 10:10pm Jekyll & Hyde - 140 South 18th Street! ASK ABOUT EVIL DRINK SPECIAL!!!

9:30 - 10:10pm Rusty Barrel Saloon - NEW BAR! 153 South 18th Street, $2 Any drink (not top shelf). Smoking Bar

TWO BARS - ps. Remember RULE #1 (see below)

10:20pm - 11:10pm White Eagle - 2300 East Carson Street $2.50 Domestic Drafts Smoking Bar

10:20pm - 11:10pm SOUTHPAW - NEW BAR! 2210 East Carson Street. THEY HAVE A BAND: "BOAT SHOES, BAD NEWS!" no cover for crawlers! $2 Cans, $5 Bomb drinks, SMOKED WINGS!

11:15pm to Close LAVA Lounge - 2204 E. Carson Street DJ & Dancing $2.75 PBR special

Do NOT DRINK AND DRIVE! Classy Cab [masked]Yellow Cab (412)[masked] OR USE UBER\LYFT!!!

THE RULES: Number 1. RULE: No Whining!!!

2. Our Dues have tripled it now costs NO MONEY!!! to go on crawls. UNLESS It's A CHARITY CRAWL and then it's still CHEAP! This is a Charity crawl so it's $5 a person. Remember we are doing this for the hell of it!!!

3. It is good to tip; it is not so good to assume you know the best place to put the bills.

4. If you ignore the whistle and show up late to the next bar or without a nametag, you may not get the special and you may have to pay the cover to get in. You can get nametags at the first 3 bars.

5. You are responsible for your behavior. If you get drunk, it is your own fault, not our fault and not the bar's. Take a cab home.(We recommend Classy Cab or UBERX I like going home in a Limo).

6. You are also responsible for the people you invite. If you know someone is a nasty or problem drunk, do not invite him..her. The pub-crawl is not the place for him/her to display his/her talents. If you cause a problem, you will be asked to leave and so will the person who invited you. We have a good reputation.

OK so we read that folks out in the Irwin area want a meet up event .. well here you go.

We're seeing the Band: Right Turn Clyde at the Doublewide Grill in North Huntington Irwin PA on Sat. Feb 27th. NO COVER! Come and see, this is cross-posted on several other meetups so we'll be bringing about 20 other people along. It's the return of Right TurnClyde to the Mar's PA. NO COVER and always a party !!!

results.description:
Its that time of year ... shorter days ... schools in full swing ... and well, we all want to keep skating!

For those who haven't skated the off season with us before, these are slightly less organized, unpatrolled skated.    What that means is distance and terrain varies.   Most likely there will be a hill or two ... maybe three.    And distance is usually 15-20 miles over about two to two and half hours.    We'll still be looking out for the last skater and regrouping periodically, and including an optional coffee stop mid to end of the skating.       We'll continue, weather permitting (roads dry) straight through 'til spring!
results.name: Off season Sunday morning skate & coffee!

results.description:
Hi All,

We're meeting at 11:00AM at the tennis court of Schenley Park  and will play 2 hours or more.
If there are some people who want to play some tennis, please bring your racket and let's play together.

This is the event for all levels.
If you have any questions, please let me know.

Here is some guide I want to share with members. 


 ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 TENNIS MEETUP RULES

1. Always RSVP before you come to the event. This helps in organizing and for reserving the courts. Note, without RSVP you may not have a spot.

2. If you RSVPed "Yes" and later decided to not come, please change the RSVP to "No" so the first member on the waiting list can get your spot.

3. Members are expected to arrive on time and stay for the duration. If you expect to be late more than 15 minutes, please send a text message to the posted organizer's phone number.

4. We will practice and always play a game - doubles or singles, depending on the number of members who come to the event.

5. The organizer will try to pair the teams based on skill levels but this may not always be possible and the pairing may be on a first-come-first-serve basis.

6. If a member is on the waiting list they can still come, however they may have to wait for courts to become available.
  ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

  Jason,
results.name: Sunday morning tennis for all levels - Schenley

We'll meet at the gazebo near the track and jog to the trail entrance at Bartlett Street.  Then we'll jog through the trail to where it exits at Greenfield Avenue.  We'll do some moderate-pace hill jogs (optional) at that point before returning to the track.  Total jogging is about 3 miles.  The trails are such that you can more-or-less run at your own pace and stay connected to the group.  Hope to see you there!

results.description:
Rebekah Gamble, HP, has studied shamanic practice, meditative therapies including past life regression, and many similar practices for many years. One day, a mentor of hers made a comment that in a way, past life work was like journeying to middle world. She happened to also be finishing a degree in metaphysical sciences at the University of Metaphysical Sciences at the time, where reincarnation studies and hypnotherapy were offered. Rebekah was curious about that thought, and started playing with the different forms of past life regression she had developed with her own self-healing work and combining it with shamanic methods she was using for soul retrieval work. Over time, these curiosities combined with her studies at UMS led to developing several new methods to perform past life regression.
For the past two years, Rebekah has been testing her theories and practices on volunteers in both academic settings, with volunteer clients at her clinical practice, and with personal friends. She has had great success teaching people how to do their own past life regression work using shamanic methods, even over a distance and in small groups. She's finally ready to present the techniques in a workshop format so you can enjoy the experience and take control of your own healing.


This workshop will include a general discussion of reincarnation, the soul from the perspective of indigenous people as well as science and pop culture, and reincarnation theories from around the world. We will also discuss scientific evidence and case studies that suggest reincarnation as a plausible possiblity and other explanations for these experiences besides reincarnation before actually doing the regression exercises.

We will do several regressions with the intent of you being able to experience a method you can recreate on your own. We will also show how this process can be applied to self healing, exploring and healing relationships, and healing fears.

For the regressions, we will do the exercises, then have some quiet time where you can journal and process. After this, you will have the opportunity to share your experiences.

This is the first time this has ever been presented. Spaces are limited to SEVEN participants. Cost of the workshop is $40 at the door, $35 pre-paid. You may send pre-payments to [masked] via paypal. We encourage prepaying for this event to guarantee your space, but caution that refunds will only be provided should the host cancel the event.

What are folks saying about their experiences with the new methods?

"So much of my life makes sense now. I don't have to be afraid of me anymore." -M.K., 2015

"I've always had this obsession with certain things. Now it makes sense, and now I know how to overcome it, thanks to your training." -K.C., 2016

"Thank you so much. My marriage is so much better now, and I've stopped sabotaging both of us. I feel so much safer, I can't express what this has done for us." -S.S., 2015
results.name: Exploring Past Lives Using Shamanic Techniques Workshop

Please sign up if you're planning on playing and bring your favorite games!  Newbies are very welcome.  We have some great teachers to help you get started on your gaming adventure.  Let us know when you sign up what game(s) you'll be bringing.  On Sundays there is plenty of free parking on the side streets and even right on Murray.  Crazy Mocha serves great coffee, specialty drinks, snacks and pastries.  They do allow us to bring food in if we take our trash with us. We usually play all day, break for dinner around 6:00, then it's back to gaming until everybody poops out. 

Incidentally, many of our regular players no longer bother to sign up (but I really wish they would!), so if it looks like only  one or two people are coming, there could actually be quite a few more.  Remember, I will always cancel a game Meetup if we aren't gaming that day, so you won't be sitting there all by yourself waiting for a friend.    And please, remember to change your rsvp to no if you can't make it that day!

$1.00 will be charged to help cover the fee Meetup charges and to buy games for the group.  Join us and let the games begin!!!

results.description:
FREE CONCERT! World Kaleidoscope presents: Aidana Yntykbayeva

Aidana Yntykbayeva will perform on on the Kobyz, a traditional bowed string instrument from Kazakhstan. Constructed of a single piece of wood, the instrument is multifaceted in its sound, possessing an unusual and colorful timbre, from the mimicry of voices to an enchantment of the soul.

Aidana received her Bachelor's Degree at the Kazakh National University of Arts, in Astana, Kazakhstan, after twelve years of music school in Karaganda, and has performed with distinction in national and international competitions.

Stop by the Library to capture the melodies drifting in from half a world away!

Free.  All ages.
results.name: FREE CONCERT! World Kaleidoscope presents: Aidana Yntykbayeva

results.description:
Film at 3 pm.

Described by some critics as a "Romanian Western", Aferim! has been aptly compared to films as diverse as The Searchers, The Last Detail and Pulp Fiction (the latter for its rambling, coarse and endlessly entertaining dialogues). The story follows a police officer and his son as they travel across a barren feudal landscape in pursuit of a runaway gypsy slave. In their journey they encounter people of different religions and nationalities, each with their own prejudices and opinions. Beautifully shot in black & white, this stunning tale incorporates both humor and history. Alternating between action scenes and surreal dialogue, the film is a gripping look at the political and religious landscape of 19th century Eastern Europe rife with meanings for today. Selected as Romania’s official Oscar entry for Best Foreign Language Film.

Radu Jude | Romania | 2015 | 108 min

TRAILER:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mmTYOY_jQWc
results.name: Aferim! Romanian film @ Harris Theater

results.description:
Join local makers, do-ers, thinkers, educators, craftspeople, builders, and humans of all variety at TechShop Pittsburgh on the last Sunday of every month for an all new industry artisan lecture series. There will be light refreshments provided.

Suggested Donation, $5. Donations will be used to off-set the cost of the event, and to build the event in the future. They can be made at the door!

Featuring in February: 

Oreen Cohen:
http://www.oreencohen.com/

With a visceral approach towards material and site, Oreen creates publicly performed actions and sculptural interventions that attempt to transform transient spaces into places of meaning. Symbolic industrial materials and gesture is used to cultivate social allegories that re-interpret the past, solidify the present, and anticipate the future. 

Sean Derry:
http://www.seanderry.com/

Sean Derry grew up in Alaska. His family moved to the territory via steamship in the late nineteenth century and later established one of the largest commercial reindeer herds in the history of Alaska. Derry’s ongoing interest in mechanical devices and amateur engineering can be, at least partially, attributed to his childhood experience repairing Craftsman lawn mowers. In his artistic practice, he explores the lived experience of a place and investigates alternative strategies for inhabiting these environments. Derry’s work includes installations, commissions and curatorial projects. He has developed projects for the Rivers of Steel Heritage Area, Trust for Public Land, Anchorage Museum at the Rasmuson Center, Art in Action, National Institute for Fitness and Sport, and Waterman Agricultural Center. He has completed public commissions for the University of Alaska, the City of Indianapolis, and Indianapolis Cultural Trail. In 2006, Derry’s commission, Charting Pogue’s Run, was featured in the Americans for the Arts Year in Review. Derry is the recipient of grants from the Sprout Fund, Mid Atlantic Arts Foundation, Pennsylvania Council on the Arts, Alaska State Council on the Arts, and Edith Fergus-Gilmore Trust. Sean Derry currently lives in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania and is the area head of sculpture at Indiana University of Pennsylvania.

Register at: http://techshoppgh.com/lectures
results.name: Industry Artisan Lecture Series No. 1 Meet Up

**RUEDA DE BACHATA 6-WEEK SERIES!!**


Join us for an exciting new 6-week series to take your Bachata skills to the next level!! Rueda de Bachata carries the same concept as Rueda de Casino, but instead with Bachata steps and music. Couples dance in a circle while there is a caller who calls out the steps. Check out this video to see how Rueda de Bachata comes together:


https://youtu.be/-FGjjH3ODgI

In this series, our goal is to HAVE FUN while learning a new concept!! This style of dance is growing very quickly and something that you will start to see in weekly socials in the Pittsburgh area. Be the first to learn and understand how to put this concept into action. This series is open to all dance levels, as there are 100s of moves that can be incorporated into the course. Let’s see how far we can challenge ourselves!!


Space is limited so reserve your spot today!

results.name: Clerks

results.description:
This is a 'feel good' movie.  Subtitles in French (pour malentendants).  This continues on the 'theme' of dysfunctional families - of which there are a lot.

The Béliers are ordinary people: Rodolphe and Gigi are married, have two children and run their farm for a living. Ordinary people? Well, almost... since three of them, Dad, Mum and their son Quentin, are deaf. Which is not the case of the boy's big sister, Paula. And not only can she speak but her music teacher scouts her beautiful voice as well. He offers her to sit for the entrance exam of the Maîtrise de Radio France, a vocal elite choir in Paris. Her parents, who rely on her as their ears and mouth in the outside world, take the news badly. Paula, who hates the idea of betraying her parents and her brother, goes through a painful dilemma... 


Allo Ciné

Dans la famille Bélier, tout le monde est sourd sauf Paula, 16 ans. Elle est une interprète indispensable à ses parents au quotidien, notamment pour l’exploitation de la ferme familiale. Un jour, poussée par son professeur de musique qui lui a découvert un don pour le chant, elle décide de préparer le concours de Radio France. Un choix de vie qui signifierait pour elle l’éloignement de sa famille et un passage inévitable à l’âge adulte.

results.description:
If anybody wants to get together to kick off the season, you can come workup a mighty sweat at my gym. (there is no fee, just pitch in a few bucks if you can)

 I have no formal agenda but you are welcome to join in my routine.  I have a boxing buzzer set for 1 min on, 1 minute breaks, but I start with 10 minutes of intense stretching then go right into 2 minute rounds of jump rope for 5 rounds.

I then do one minute drills of pushups, jumping jacks, high jumps, climbers and lunges and sprints.

After that i will hit on the heavy bags (I have 7) for a few rounds, kick the bags for a few rounds, and then either work the speed bag or head hunter.  

That usually has me exhausted.   There are a couple of us that do this but the more the merrier.   I am not selling anything nor promoting anything, just trying to offer a place to get started until the weather breaks.   

I do have a lot of bag gloves, focus mitts, knee/elbow strike pads, kicking pads, uppercut bags and everything you might want, but if you have gloves, towel and your own agenda, please bring it.  If you want to bring a friend and do your own routine, that's fine too.  

Dates and times can be adjusted, I have the luxury of having full access.

results.description:
https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/15796700-americanah

From the award-winning author of Half of a Yellow Sun, a dazzling new novel: a story of love and race centered around a young man and woman from Nigeria who face difficult choices and challenges in the countries they come to call home.

As teenagers in a Lagos secondary school, Ifemelu and Obinze fall in love. Their Nigeria is under military dictatorship, and people are leaving the country if they can. Ifemelu—beautiful, self-assured—departs for America to study. She suffers defeats and triumphs, finds and loses relationships and friendships, all the while feeling the weight of something she never thought of back home: race. Obinze—the quiet, thoughtful son of a professor—had hoped to join her, but post-9/11 America will not let him in, and he plunges into a dangerous, undocumented life in London.

Years later, Obinze is a wealthy man in a newly democratic Nigeria, while Ifemelu has achieved success as a writer of an eye-opening blog about race in America. But when Ifemelu returns to Nigeria, and she and Obinze reignite their shared passion—for their homeland and for each other—they will face the toughest decisions of their lives.

Fearless, gripping, at once darkly funny and tender, spanning three continents and numerous lives, Americanah is a richly told story set in today’s globalized world: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie’s most powerful and astonishing novel yet.
results.name: February's Book Club: Americanah Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie

results.description:
Join us on Tuesdays for American Mah Jong! Folks begin arriving around 5PM, and play begins table by table as soon as we have three or four players plus a set.  (We usually have 3-5 tables.)  By 6:15 or so, most players have arrived. We rotate among the tables... at the end of each game, East walks around to see if another table is close to the end of their game, so that two players can swap places.   At the other end of the evening... play must end by 9PM when Panera closes.  Tables begin wrapping up play any time after 8:15 or so.


If you have never played, or if you have not played for a very long time, we highly recommend that you take a Mah Jong 101 beginner class before playing with us - beginner classes are offered every few months.  Mah jong is a wonderful game, but it's hard to learn by just watching others play!


Please order your 2015 card from the National Mah Jongg League, here: http://www.nationalmahjonggleague.org/ Amazon.com also carries the cards. Note that you want the NMJL card, and no other! (There are some colorful alternatives out there.. but we play NMJL card and rules.)

Experienced players -- please bring your cards and please bring a set if you have one.

Please do not bring any outside food or beverages into Panera! Instead, please plan to buy *something* from Panera, even if it's just a beverage or a cookie, to support their willingness to host us.
results.how_to_find_us: Hard to miss us, look for the Mah Jong sets!

Price - Minimum donation of $5 at the door!

Although intuition is part of human nature, understanding and utilizing it may not come so naturally.  Rebecca will cover the complete basics of how intuition works, how your body receives impressions, and how to interpret what you're getting. Everyone can become more intuitive!

During the presentation you will learn:

-What receiving "intuitive impressions" means.

-Six ways that the body receives impressions.

-How to differentiate impressions from imagination.

-Various ways to practice developing intuition.

As a certified instructor, professional speaker, and consultant, Rebecca Troup has been educating adults for more than 26 years in the business, medical, and metaphysical fields.  She has become well known and respected for her unique ability to present information in a fun, easy-to-understand manner while retaining the depth of the material.  Her approach to shifting everyday perceptions has helped countless individuals enjoy a happier life. In addition to extensive private study, Rebecca has enjoyed learning with many talented individuals from the United States and abroad.  She has been invited to speak at expositions, seminars, radio, colleges, churches, libraries, and bookstores.

To schedule an appointment visit www.MysticalTruths.com

The LSG Metaphysical Lectures is a once monthly meetup that spotlights local Metaphysical, Alternative Wellness, or Spiritual practitioners.

As always there will be cupcakes for sale after the event!

To see future presenters visit www.lsglb.com

results.description:
The Pittsburgh Data Visualization Group is now the Data Visualization Collaborative!  Join us at our initial meeting in early March to learn more about where the group is headed and how to be a part of the 2016 leadership team. Day and time to be announced. 

As of February 2016, Daniel Narey is taking over the reigns as lead organizer of the group. In an effort to transition the group to a member-driven and self-sustaining organization, Daniel is looking to recruit 3 to 5 people to join him as the 2016 Leadership Team. The outside time commitment will be minimal, but members of the Leadership Team will be expected to attend a one-hour planning meeting each month, and each member will have the opportunity to take the lead in organizing one event for 2016.  

While this initial spring meeting is open to all, it will be of particular interest to those who would like to take part in shaping what we do over the next year. Daniel has a few ideas in mind for growing participation, but he needs your input and feedback. Here are some things he has been thinking about:

• Workshops exploring the intersection of data with design—in particular, designing for user interaction with data


• Training opportunities for people who want to learn particular data visualization frameworks and tools (e.g., d3 for JavaScript, ggplot2 for R, matplotlib for Python, Tableau for non-coders)


• Collaboration on a project to use data visualization for social good


Please feel free to contact Daniel with any questions you may have or ideas you would like to bring to the group. If you are planning to attend, you can let him know by Feb 15 which days/times in the first or second week of March would work best for you.
results.how_to_find_us: We will be in the 2nd floor conference room. Use the Penn Avenue entrance and take the stairs or elevator to the second floor. The conference room is inside 201 to the left. Confirmed attendees will receive building access instructions.
results.name: Leadership Recruitment Meeting - Spring 2016

results.description:
This presentation will help coders thrive when their roles expand to include the development and commercialization of a new product. 

Insights from this presentation will help individuals balance their roles as:

• Providers of code that build to specifications in selected languages

• Individuals that prefer to work in isolation or as part of a small group working separately from contributors with other specialties

• Agents within a complex adaptive system that share responsibilities within a network 

• Professionals that are expected to shape the focus and direction of the project and thus impact the outcome

• Individuals with other responsibilities


Attendees will be able to:

• Explain the difference of being done with an item such as a user story and successful commercialization

• List six ways to improve synergy in a new product development network

• Correlate improvements in antifragility with winning


About the Presenter:

Mark A. Hart is a new product developer and a certified New Product Development Professional (NPDP). Since 1983, Mark has contributed to the development and commercialization of technology products (such as measurement systems for scientists and engineers, software, computers, and training applications) that have become global leaders in their categories.

LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/mahart
results.name: From Coding to the Development of a Commercial Product: How to Survive & Thrive

results.description:
Join us for a 2-hour session of indoor volleyball open gym! You'll get a ton of playing time in a well-organized event. Our host will check players in, divide players into teams, and make sure that everything runs smoothly. All you have to do is show up ready to play!

Pricing:

• $7 - RSVP online and pay in advance (online rsvp closes at 4:30 pm!)

• $9 - RSVP and pay cash at the event

• $10 - Show up and play - be sure to check online to make sure there is room!

What to Wear: We are playing indoors on a rubberized all-sport surface. Most players wear volleyball-specific shoes, but gym shoes are also allowed. Please bring your shoes and change into them at the facility. This will help keep the floor clean of dirt and water.

What to Expect: Show up early! The games will begin at the time posted for this event. Players can start checking in with the event host as early as 15 minutes before the scheduled start time. If a court is available, you may begin warming up before the event begins. We limit play to 42 players per evening, which is 3 teams of 7 players per court. If we have 3 teams on a court, winners stay once and then shuffle out so everyone gets to play. If less people are in attendance, we divide based on who is there and mix things up half way through the session.

Level of Play: This event is open to all levels of play. We do our best to create even teams so that games are well-matched. Our ideal scenario is having one court of higher skilled players and one court of more recreational players. There are no referees, so players need to play with sportsmanship and make their own calls. We aim to make everyone feel welcome at these events.

Facility Information: Monroeville Sports Center is located at 855 Macbeth Drive in Monroeville. Parking should be ample in the free lot.

Minimum number of players and playing formats. This event needs a minimum of 12 people (not including the host) signed up before the start of the event in order to run. An email notification will be sent if we cancel. Refunds or credits will be issued if we cancel the event. Sign up early to encourage more people to sign up!!

Do Your Part! Help us keep an accurate guest count! If you RSVP, we're counting on you to be there. If you change your mind about playing or your guest count changes, please update your RSVP. No-Shows will be marked on your account. If space is tight, we hold RSVP spots 10 minutes into advertised start and then open spots to walk-ups.

Requirements to play: This is an adult volleyball group. You must be 19 older. Males and females of all skill levels are welcome to play. There is no required gender ratio. Players are expected to conduct themselves with good sportsmanship.

What's included in the price? Your payment helps to cover the rental costs, the hourly pay for your event host, and ensures a well-organized event.

Questions? Post your question in the comments section of this meetup and the event host or one of our organizers will reply. You can also message the organizers directly through meetup. Or, give us a call M-F 8:00am-12:30pm:[masked]-7130.

results.description:
Bagels & Bytes is technology-related peer learning and networking at its best!

Bring your tech questions, ideas, and issues. Join our fellowship of nonprofit techies (professional and "accidental" are equally welcome) as we brainstorm, share ideas and solutions, and support each other!

Both groups are very supportive and non-judgmental. There is no such thing as a "stupid" question at these meetings - all questions and topics for discussion are welcomed.  

We learn from each other in unexpected ways constantly, regardless of knowledge or skill levels. Hence, you don't have to be an "expert" techie to attend, just curious and interested in nonprofit technology. 

Bagels & Bytes is free to attend, but you must RSVP.

results.description:
Please join us for an evening of great jazz at NOLA as we also welcome many new members to our group.

NOLA ON THE SQUARE, a New Orleans Jazz Brasserie located on beautifully renovated Market Square. A breathtaking transformation of the storied 1902 Landmark Tavern, a Nouveau Creole menu, live jazz and blues music Wednesday, Friday and Saturday evenings all contribute to that Big Easy vibe.

Meetup Considerations

Because everyone has different work schedules and commuting distances to downtown, we'll incorporate flexibility. For example, we'll begin gathering around 6-6:30 PM although others in the group are certainly welcome to arrive even earlier to enjoy more of the happy hour. We'll also have a reserved section for our group in the dining area of NOLA so people will have a chance to talk and eat/drink together while also enjoying great jazz.

The live jazz for the evening of March 2 will begin at 8 PM with the Rick Matt band who will be performing from 8-11 PM with several music breaks.

So if you're relatively new to Meetup, this would be a nice event to attend to meet lots of people in a fun, very relaxed, and convenient setting while enjoying some great live music with a great atmosphere.  People will have the option of just stopping by for a little while, or just getting a quick drink or some appetizers, or if they prefer ordering a full dinner (depending on how hungry they are). There will also be plenty of time to socialize and meet everyone before the live jazz starts at 8 PM as well as during the music breaks.


As always, please feel free to invite friends.


About NOLA

To check out the NOLA full dinner menu, please visit http://www.nolaonthesquare.com/assets/dinner.pdf

There will also be daily specials!

For vegan/vegetarian/gluten-free options, please visit http://www.nolaonthesquare.com/assets/veg.pdf

Lunch & sandwiches http://www.nolaonthesquare.com/assets/lunch.pdf

Beer/cocktails http://www.nolaonthesquare.com/assets/beer.pdf

Wine selections http://www.nolaonthesquare.com/assets/veg.pdf

For more information about NOLA, please visit http://www.nolaonthesquare.com/

Parking Here is the ParkPGH website with real-time info on downtown parking garage availability http://parkpgh.org where you can also download apps, get garage availability via text messaging, etc. You can also call[masked]-8980.

There is also the convenience of Market Square Valet parking. Stroll by and come see NOLA On The Square.

results.description:
I. Agenda, Introductions & Challenges Forum (6:30 PM-8:20 PM)


Please arrive between 6:25 PM and 6:35 PM to get your name badge, buy a snack/drink to support our host venue, mix-and-mingle, and complete the Challenges Forum signup form so we can start promptly at 6:45pm with Introductions!

A. Mix & Mingle - Time to get coffee or a snack, settle in and complete the Challenges Forum signup form before the GTDNYC Meetup begins. Please arrive in enough time so we can secure the appropriate seating!

B. Introductions - Each member will introduce yourself briefly, tell us what you do professionally, your GTD experience, and a recent success with your productivity implementation and/or life. I'll also go over the programmatic details of the GTD Meetups and other GTD and productivity events available to you!

C. Challenges Forum - We'll give a few minutes to have the group help each member with solutions to challenges we may be facing currently with life or work circumstances with our productivity system. These are specific productivity challenges and only one challenge per member for time's sake.

II. Discussion: Getting to Getting Things Done (~8:20 - 8:45 PM)

For our inaugural Getting Things Done Pittsburgh Productivity Group's Meetup, let's have the group discuss your experiences with Getting Things Done (GTD) and how you have implemented it so far, and what your GTD goals are for 2016 and beyond. For those new to GTD, we'll cover ways for you to get started on building an improved personal productivity system using the GTD methodology. It should be a fun discussion as we get to know each other.

Please feel free to bring your copy of GTD for reference, your questions and recommendations as well! Your conversation contributions are what make the discussions awesome!

III. GTD Resource Sharing (8:45 PM) -- CATEGORY: Health/Fitness

This is where everyone can offer a book title, recent blog or magazine article, tip/trick/hack, tool, smartphone app, service or item that has helped them in their life productively either with GTD or otherwise. The above category is a recommended focus for sharing, but you may share any productivity resource that has helped you on your GTD journey.

I encourage everyone to bring some kind of GTD or personal productivity resource they know about or use to offer to the group!

IV. Announcements / Closing Remarks (8:50 PM)

Upcoming Meetup events, and additional programs, announcements will be given. If you are not receiving the Meetup notifications about Meetups and our other productivity activities (e.g., Productivity Book Group, #ProdChat, the weekly Twitter chat, and Productivity Café), please sign up directly here for email notifications. All announcements must be sent to the Meetup Organizer via a Meetup message to announce to the group, at his/her sole discretion. Thank you!

Do you mind helping support this Meetup? This Meetup can now receive small contributions to help it grow. Chip in here!
results.name: Getting to Getting Things Done! | GTD Pittsburgh

results.description:
It's an otherwise ordinary Monday when Meghan Fitzmaurice's perfect life hits a wall. A household name as the host of 'Rise and Shine', the country's highest-rated morning talk show, Meghan cuts to a commercial break, but not before she mutters two forbidden words into her open mike. In an instant, it's the end of an era - not only for Meghan, who is unaccustomed to dealing with adversity, but also for her younger sister, Bridget, a social worker in the Bronx who has always lived in Meghan's long shadow. The effect of Meghan's on-air truth-telling reverberates through both of their lives, affecting Meghan's son, husband, friends, and fans, as well as Bridget's perception of her sister, their complex childhood, and herself. What follows is a story about how, in very different ways, the Fitzmaurice women adapt, survive, and manage to bring the whole teeming world of New York to heel, by dint of their smart mouths, quick wits, and the powerful connection between them that even the worst tragedy cannot shatter.

Please Bring a Chick Lit/Women's Fiction book (that is out in paperback)!

Not sure what to bring?

Here is the definition of Chick Lit: Chick lit is genre fiction within women's fiction which addresses issues of modern women often humorously and lightheartedly*

Here is the definition of Women's Fiction: a modern novel about a woman on the brink of life change and personal growth. Her journey details emotional reflection and action that transforms her and her relationships with others, and  usually includes a hopeful/upbeat ending with regard to her romantic relationship.

results.description:
The Thurs., March 3 Biophilia: Pittsburgh meeting will feature artist Elise Adibi, who will talk about her project “Respiration Paintings,” a series of paintings made with 100% pure essential oils which are distilled from plants and used for aromatherapy. Adibi calls these paintings “Respiration Paintings” because she sees them as existing not only as physical objects, but also in the air; when they are first exhibited, the paintings emit scents that allow an audience to breathe them as well as see them. While her use of aromatherapy oils in oil painting is new, plant oils such as linseed and safflower have been used since the beginning of oil painting. Adibi’s paintings investigate the etheric substance that binds together the viewer and the painting through a living force. Her use of plant oils connects contemporary abstract painting to its pre-modern history of materials, engaging the tradition of oil painting and renewing its potential for healing through a recovered connection to the natural world.

Elise Adibi currently has a studio at 7800 Susquehanna Street and is working on an upcoming show for the greenhouse at The Frick Pittsburgh in 2017. Adibi received a MFA from Columbia University, she also has a BA in Philosophy from Swarthmore College, and a Master of Architecture from the University of Pennsylvania. In 2013 and 2014 Adibi was a Fellow at The Radcliffe Institute for Advanced Study at Harvard University. She has twice received grants from The Pollock-Krasner Foundation, and in 2007, The Terra Foundation awarded her a fellowship in Giverny, France (Monet’s village). In 2010, Adibi worked with the Pittsburgh Center for the Arts/Pittsburgh Filmmakers to curate “Gold in Braddock” at UnSmoke Art Systems. In 2011, Adibi was included in the Pittsburgh Biennial,“Gertrude’s/LOT,” at The Andy Warhol Museum, curated by Eric Shiner. Adibi’s work has been reviewed in Artforum, The New York Times, The Boston Globe, the Pittsburgh Post-Gazette and The Harvard Advocate, among other publications.

Meeting Schedule: 
5:30 – 6 p.m.            Networking and refreshments 
6 – 6:30 p.m.            Presentation 
6:30 – 7:30 p.m.      Discussion

Directions and Parking:  
This meeting will take place in the Center for Sustainable Landscapes (CSL) Classroom which is located on the facility’s first floor. The main Conservatory entrance will be closed, as this meeting takes place after normal hours; to access the CSL, follow Frew Street (located between the Oakland/Schenley Park bridge and the Christopher Columbus statue), which will take you around the Conservatory to the lower campus. Guest parking spaces are available on your left as you approach the CSL.
results.name: Biophilia: Pittsburgh March Meeting: Respiration Paintings

Jim is a longtime beekeeping instructor, as well as a member of the Beaver Valley Area Beekeepers Association and a member of the Western PA Beekeeping Seminar Committe.  We will also taste a single varietal honey as part of the meeting.  We taste a different honey at every meeting we have for the club as a fun activity.  If you would like to bring a varietal honey to introduce and taste or lead the monthly discussion, please contact Joe Zgurzynski, the meeting organizer.

results.description:
The ability to communicate effectively is one of the most important skills you can develop.  Businesses need people who are able to express themselves clearly and confidently.  Whether you are informally communicating a proposal or making a formal presentation, the ability to communicate confidently and persuasively is essential to your success.

Toastmasters clubs utilize structured meetings to practice communication and leadership skills in a friendly and constructive setting.  By participating in meetings you will develop quick-thinking skills, how to do constructive criticism and gain experience in communication.  You will also have fun and make new friends.

The Toastmasters program is a proven way to help you improve public speaking and leadership skills.  If you are interested, please attend any of the upcoming Oakmont Toastmasters Club meetings.

Club meetings are held every Thursday from 6:15 - 8:00 PM.

Are you ready for CHANGE? Are you ready to stop hiding your LIGHT and start playing your BIGGER GAME?

Ready to conspire with the UNIVERSE and work smarter - not harder?
